loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beams and metal roofing

loans.name: Phoern

texts.en:
A resident from a rural village of the Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province, Phoern is a 40-year-old mother of three children, two of whom are still dependent on her and still in school. The main sources of the family’s income are from planting cassava and selling bananas by motor in a local area. She has been in this business for fifteen years.

This is the fourth loan for Phoern with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. The first loan has helped her relieve her family's burden and support her children’s education. Now she is requesting for a loan of 1,500 USD to buy a new motorbike for her banana selling business and use a portion of it to spend on buying fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to earn more income from her current business so as to improve her lifestyle and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to spend on buying fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Gloria Micaela

texts.es:
La señora Gloria Micaela esta casada, tiene 34 años de edad, cursó los 6 años de educacion primaria, tiene 1 hijo, el cual estudia ahora, se dedica a la tejeduría de cortes típicos, y actualmente esta trabajando en el tejido de fajas y cintas típicas, inició este negocio como trabajadora en otro negocio, y hasta el momento lleva 5 años de experiencia en tejer fajas y cintas típicas, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica a la construcción de vivienda.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de materia prima, como hilos y laborares de diferente colores y diseños, para que así aumente su producción de tejidos, ya que espera mejorar y seguir creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
Gloria Micaela is married. She is 34 years old. She finished six years of primary school education. She has a son, who is a student now. 

She works weaving traditional pieces. Currently is is working weaving traditional belts and sashes. She began this business as a worker in another business, and up until now has 5 years of experience weaving traditional belts and sashes. She has the support of her husband who works building houses.

She is asking for a loan that she will use to buy raw materials such as yarn for making different colors and designs so that she can increase her production of weavings as she hopes to improve and continue expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy thread to weave traditional belts and sashes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a cotton candy machine and supplies.

loans.name: Germán De Jesús

texts.es:
Don Germán es un hombre de 46 años de edad, que le ha tocado vivir las inclemencias de una sociedad violenta. Desplazado por la violencia, se radicó en el municipio de Bello, Colombia. Comenzó a buscar empleo inducido por la necesidad de generar ingresos y poder subsistir. Laboró en una zapatería en donde aprendió el oficio. 

Con su disciplina logró ahorrar un dinero con el que decidió independizarse y montar en su casa un taller de Calzado en donde realiza todo tipo de arreglos. Su vida hoy ha mejorado considerablemente, pero desea poder mejorarla. Por esta razón ha decidido buscar un préstamo con el fin de comprar materiales para comenzar a elaborar calzado ampliando sus servicios y generando mayores ingresos que le permitan gozar de una vida digna. Su mayor sueño es poder convertirse en un gran empresario y montar un gran negocio de fabricación y venta de calzado.
texts.en:
Germán is a 46 year old man who has had to live with an increasingly violent society.   Displaced by the violence, he relocated to the city of Bello, Colombia, where he began looking for work.  Out of a need to generate an income, he worked in a shoe repair shop where he learned the trade. 

Through discipline he was able to save some money with which he started his own shoe repair shop.  There he makes all kinds of repairs.  His life has improved considerably but he would like to make it better.  He is asking for this loan so that he can buy supplies to be able to begin making shoes, expand his services, and generate more income so that he can enjoy a dignified life.  His greatest dream is to be become a great entrepreneur and build a grand shoe making and sales business.

loans.use: to buy shoe making supplies.

loans.name: Lang's Group

texts.en:
Lang is a villager who resides in a rural area of the Moung Russey district located in Battambang province, Cambodia.  She is 57 years of age and she is married with two children.  

Lang makes a living through farming rice on a hectare plot of farmland.  Having been in the current business for 10 years, she is able to earn around 15,000 KHR per day. Lang is leading a loan group comprised of two female members who are both first-time borrowers with VisionFund (Kiva's partner) to take out a loan in the amount of 1,500,000 KHR in total.  As the group leader, Lang will use her portion of the loan, which is 1,000,000 KHR, to support her rice-growing business by buying fertilizer and to operate a new business by buying piglets to raise. 

In the future, Lang hopes to be able to buy more plots of farmland in order to expand her rice-growing business, which is the business that provides the main source of her family's income, and generate more income for the family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and piglets.

loans.name: Touch's Group

texts.en:
Touch is a 53-year-old married woman who resides in a rural village of Battambang's Moung Russey district in Cambodia.  She has seven children, three of whom (all sons) remain under her responsibility.  

To support the family, Touch farms rice and plants pineapples, earning around 48,000 KHR daily.  She is leading a group comprised of three female members, all of whom are third-time borrowers with VisionFund (Kiva's partner), to seek a loan in the amount of 1,400,000 KHR each.  As the group representative, Touch comments that the previous loans have helped her to relieve the burdens of her family.  This time, she will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer to support her business.  This hard-working woman dreams to be able to build a warm house in which her beloved family can live.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Thy

texts.en:
Thy is 31 years old and lives in Battambang province's Ek Phnom district in Cambodia.  He is married and a father of four dependent children.  Some of his children are currently in school. 

Thy earns a living through farming rice and planting beans. This will be his first time requesting a loan via VisionFund (Kiva's partner).  Thy is seeking a loan of 3,000,000 KHR in order to support his business by buying fertilizer.  After receiving the requested loan and using it in a smart manner, Thy believes that he can increase his income and improve his family’s standard of living.  He is also willing to use the anticipated income to further educate his beloved children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Sokhorn's Group

texts.en:
Sokhorn resides in the Thmor Koul district in Cambodia's Battambang province.  She is 49 years old and married.  She is also a mother of four children, one of whom (a son) is a student. 

To make a living, Sokhorn operates a business, selling noodle with soup, which is known as Kuyteav in Cambodia.  Sokhorn's husband supplements their income by raising pigs. This industrious couple earns around 60,000 KHR per day and saves approximately 28,000 KHR after offsetting the daily cost of living.  

Sokhorn has been with VisionFund, Kiva's partner, for four loan cycles.  With her previous loans, she succeeded in increasing her working capital and meeting her family’s food needs.  Now, to support her husband's pig-raising business, Sokhorn is leading a group with one other member who has been with VisionFund for just one loan cycle to take out a new loan in the amount of 1,200,000 KHR in total.  Sokhorn will spend her portion of the loan to buy pig feed.  She hopes to earn more income from the pig-raising business and better support her family after receiving the loan and effectively using it.

loans.use: to buy pig feed.

loans.name: Savien's Group

texts.en:
Savien is a resident of Thmor Koul district in Battambang province, Cambodia. She is a 41-year-old married mother of five children, four of whom (two daughters and two sons) are under her care and currently attend school. Savien earns a living by farming rice on a two-hectare plot. 

A first-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva's partner), Savien is leading a group member who is a second-time borrower to take out loans in the amounts of 500,000 KHR and 100,000 KHR respectively. As the group leader, she will spend her portion of the loan to purchase fertilizer for her rice-growing business. This hard-working woman believes that, with this loan, she can smoothly operate her business, generating more income for her family. She is willing to use her anticipated income to further her children's educational pursuits.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Sophan's Group

texts.en: Sophan is a resident of Thmor Koul district in Cambodia's Battambang province. She is 37 years old and married with a son. To make a living, Sophan farms rice and sells cosmetics. This will be Sophan's fifth loan request through VisionFund (Kiva's partner). The previous loans helped her to successfully build a comfortable house for her family. Now she is leading a group of three women to take out a loan in the amount of 3,800,000 KHR. Sophan will use her portion of the loan to purchase fertilizer to help keep her rice-growing business in good shape. With the help of this new loan, Sophan believes that she can strengthen her rice-growing business, thereby earning more income for her family.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Marn

texts.en:
A resident from a rural village of the Kandal Stoeng district in the Kandal province, Marn is aged 52 years. She is married with six children, two of whom are dependents and still in school. For the last fifteen years, she has been working as a rice farmer. Sometimes she works in a garment factory to support the family while her husband works construction to help generate more income. Together, they can earn about US$11 per day and manage to save about US$7 each day for the future needs. 

Marn has been a member of VisionFund for one cycle already and she has successfully used the first loan to relieve her family burden and improve her livelihood. She is satisfied with the first loan and is now requesting another loan of US$1,000. She will use part of this loan to buy a motorbike and use the remainder of it to buy a cow for her farming business. This loan will enable her to have a motorbike for her children. It will also serve as a means of transportation to work. The cow will also increase farming production to help improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Ly's Group

texts.en:
Ly is a resident of a rural village in the Mongkul Borei district of Banteay Meanchey province. She is a 44-year-old married mother of five children.  Ly has earned a living, with her husband, as a rice farmer in the local area for the past six years. To supplement her family’s income, she raises chickens for resale. Now, she still has two dependent sons who are in school. Her current business earns her about KHR 30,000 per day and she manages to save about KHR 12,000 each day for future needs.

This loan is for Ly’s group of three members who reside in the same village. Ly has been a member of VisionFund for two years while the other two members have been members from two to five years. The past loans have helped Ly relieve family's burden and improve her family’s livelihood. She is satisfied with the past loans and is now leading her group members to take out another loan of KHR 1,000,000 each. She will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and chicken feed, as well as two piglets for raising as an additional source of income. Ly hopes to increase her current business and earn a larger income to improve her standard of living and also keep her sons in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Vutha's Group

texts.en:
Vutha, 39, is a married mother of three children residing in a rural village of Kandal province’s Kandal Stoeng district, Cambodia. To make a living, she has been farming rice for more than twenty years while her husband is a construction worker. Her business earns her about US$10 per day and she manages to save about US$7 each day for future needs. 

This is a group loan for Vutha’s group of four members who live in the same village. Vutha is in her second loan cycle cwhile the other members are first-time borrowers with VisionFund. She successfully used the first loan to relieve her family burden and improve her livelihood. Vutha and the other three members are applying for a loan of KHR1,000,000 each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yields so as to sell them for a larger income to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Hoeun

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in the Krokor district of Pursat province, Hoeun is aged 30 years with no kid. To make a living, she has been farming rice for 3 years and her husband also complements the income by working as a policeman in local area. The current business earns her family about US$5 per day and manages them to save about US$2 each day after offsetting daily expenses. 

Hoeun has been a member of VisionFund for three loan cycles already and she completely paid back the past loans which have helped her relieve her family's burden and improve her family's livelihood. She is satisfied with the past loans and is now applying for another loan of 1,010 USD to buy materials to build a decent house. This loan will enable her to have a decent house for living in.

loans.use: To buy materials to build a decent house

loans.name: Simas

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village located in the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Simas is 45 years old and married. She has eight children, six of whom are dependents and still in school in the local area. She and her husband earn a living by planting cassava on four hectares of farmland as the main source of the family’s income. Having been in this business for several years, she can earn about US $26 per day and can save about US $14 each day for future needs. 

Simas has been a member of Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for two loan cycles already and she completely repaid her past loans, which have helped her relieve her family's burden and improve their livelihood. Simas is satisfied with the past loans and is now applying for another loan of US $1,500. She wants to use this loan to buy fertilizers for her farmland and to spend on farm labor. She hopes to increase her crop yields and earn a larger income to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Taim

texts.en:
A resident from a rural area of the Bakan district of Pursat province, Taim is aged 44 years and has been married for five years. For the last 21 years, she has been farming rice to make a living, while her husband is a paid worker, to help generate income. The current business earns her about KHR25,000 per day and she manages to save about KHR13,000 each day for her family's future needs. 

Taim has been a member of VisionFund for three cycles already and she completely paid back the past loans, which have helped relieve her family's burden and improve their livelihood. Now requesting another loan of KHR4,000,000, Taim will use this loan to pay off her pledged farmland with a local money lender. This loan will enable her to own her farmland so that she can continue to make her living with rice farming. She hopes to make her living better.

loans.use: to pay off a local money lender for her pledged farmland

loans.name: Het's Group

texts.en:
Het is 47 years old and single. She resides in a rural village in the Tbaung Khmum district, Kampong Cham province. For more than 20 years, she has earned a living by cultivating rice on one hectare of farmland. To better meet her daily expenses, she sometimes works for pay on a rubber plantation. With her current business, she can earn about KHR 45,000 per day, of which she is able to save KHR 25,000 each day for her future needs.

Het’s group consists of three members who reside in the same village. Het is a first-time borrower, while the other members have been with VisionFund from one to two cycles. The leader of her borrower group, Het will use her portion of the loan to buy two buffaloes to help with plowing and to buy fertilizers. Owning buffaloes will allow her to increase her production, which she hopes will enable her to earn a better living.

loans.use: To buy two buffaloes to help with plowing and to buy fertilizer

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Puthy

texts.en:
Originally from a rural area located in the Krokor district of Pursat province, Puthy is aged 29 years and married with two dependent children who are still in school in the local area. She earns a living by farming rice, which she has been engaged in for ten years, while her husband supplements the family’s income by producing palm sugar and sometimes working for others for a fee. Together, they can earn about KHR25,000 per day and manage to save about KHR15,000 each day for the family's future needs.

Puthy has been a member of VisionFund for three cycles already and she has completely paid back the past loans, which have helped her relieve the family's burden and helped to afford basic household necessities. She is satisfied with the loans and is now taking out another loan of KHR2,000,000 to buy two buffalos to help with plowing the land. She hopes to increase her farming production and also earn a larger income to build on some savings to finish building a house.

loans.use: to buy two buffalos to help with plowing her farmland

loans.name: Suy's Group

texts.en:
A resident of Kampong Cham province’s Tbaung Khmum district, Suy is 25 years old and married. He has one little son who is still too young for schooling. For the last five years, Suy and his wife have planted cassava as their main source of income, and he sometimes works on a rubber plantation to earn additional income. The current business earns him about KHR 18,000 per day, of which he manages to save about KHR 10,000 each day for future needs.

Suy and his co-borrower live in the same village. Suy is a second-time borrower while his group member is a first-time borrower with VisionFund. The first loan helped Suy relieve his family's financial burdens. He and his group member are applying for a loan of KHR 1,000,000 each. Suy will use his portion of the loan to pay for labor to harvest his cassava crops. This loan will allow him to have a timely harvest, which he hopes will enable him to earn a better living.

loans.use: To pay for labor to harvest his cassava crops

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Sameth

texts.en:
Sameth, 48, is a resident from a rural village located in the Krokor district of Pursat province. She is divorced and has four children, one of whom is still dependent upon her and in school. Rice farming has been her main source of income for about twenty eight years. This business earns about KHR20,000 per day and she manages to save about KHR10,000 each day for future needs. 

This is the first loan for Sameth with VisionFund. She is applying for a loan of KHR1,300,000 to buy another plot of farmland. This loan will enable her to extend her farmland so as to increase her production. She hopes to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy another plot of farmland

loans.name: Sreymuch

texts.en:
Sreymuch, 26, is single, residing in a rural village of the Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal province. She earns a living through farming rice and working as a garment factory worker. Having been in the business for five years, she is able to earn about $5 USD per day and manages to save about $1.5 USD each day for future needs. 

This is the first VisionFund Cambodia loan for Sreymuch. Now applying for a loan of $600 USD, Sreymuch is going to use her loan to buy a motorbike, so she can commute to work. This loan will enable her to commute to work on-time and save time, so she can also work at home.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike, so she can commute to work.

loans.name: Sreyneang

texts.en: Residing in a rural area of Pursat province’s Bakan district in Cambodia, Sreyneang is 26 years of age and married. She is blessed with two daughters, both of whom are under her responsibility. Sreyneang and her husband have been farming rice on a five-hectare farmland for five years, earning around 19,000 KHR daily and managing to save approximately 9,000 KHR after deducting the cost of living. Sreyneang is applying for a KHR 2,500,000 loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for the first time. She will use her first ever requested loan to purchase fertilizer, pesticide, and gasoline. Sreyneang’s biggest hope is to be able to send her kids to school and support their education as far as possible.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en: Mom, 41 years old, lives in Bakan district in Cambodia’s Pursat province. She is married and has five children. Some of Mom’s children are students while some are employed as paid workers in Thailand. To support the family, Mom works as a rice farmer while her husband works as a fisherman. Together, they are able to earn around 15,000 KHR daily and save about 9,000 KHR after offsetting the daily expenses. Mom has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for one loan cycle already, with which she accomplished making the family’s living conditions better. Now she is leading a loan group of four female members to take out a loan for 3,700,000 KHR in total. As a group representative, Mom will spend her loan portion, which is 1,000,000 KHR, to purchase fertilizer and gasoline. This hard-working woman (Mom) would love to dedicate all her efforts to improving the family’s lifestyle and, most importantly, supporting her children’s education as far as possible.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and gasoline

loans.name: Neng's Group

texts.en:
A resident from a rural village of the Sa Ang district, Kandal province, Neng is a 56-year-old, widowed father of two children. The main source of the family’s income is planting vegetables. He has been in this business for 36 years. With the current business, Neng can earn about KHR 20,000 per day and manages to save about KHR 14,000 each day. Insect has ruined his crop yield is still the main challenge for him.

Neng has been with VisionFund for four loan cycles and completely paid back the past loans. The other group member has been with VisionFund for three cycles. Now, Neng is leading his group of two, to request another loan of KHR 1,000,000, each. As the leader, he wants to use his portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for his farmland. He hopes to grow his vegetables healthfully and fruitfully, so as to sell them for a good price.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for his farmland

loans.name: Sambat

texts.en:
Sambat, 42, lives in a rural area of the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She is widowed with four children, two of whom are dependent on her and still in school. The main source of her family’s income is rice farming on five hectares of farmland, which she has been doing for 15 years to make a living. Her husband complements the family's income by working for others for a fee. The current business earns Sambat approximately 80,000 KHR per day to meet family’s needs, but she manages to save about 20,000 KHR each day after daily expenses.
 
This is Sambat’s fourth microloan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She fully repaid the past loans which have helped her to relieve her family’s burden. Now she is requesting a loan of 1,600,000 KHR to buy a tractor for her farming business and will use a portion of it to spend on pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to get a high yield from her rice-paddy farm so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a tractor for her farming business.

loans.name: Sovan

texts.en:
Sovan is 28 years old and widowed.  She resides in a rural village located in the Kro Kor district of Pursat province.  She has three dependent children to take care of, two of whom now attend school while the third is too young for schooling.  She earns a living through farming rice and buying pigs for resale.  She has been in business for nine years and earns about 19,000 KHR per day.  She can save about 14,000 KHR each day for future needs. 

Sovan has been a member of VisionFund for four cycles already and she has completely repaid the previous loans, which have helped her relieve the family’s burden and improve her livelihood.  She is satisfied with the previous loans and is now requesting another loan of 1,500,000 KHR with VisionFund.  She will use this loan to buy fertilizers for her farmland and to provide working capital for her pig business.  She hopes to increase her current business so as to earn a larger income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland and provide working capital for her pig raising business.

loans.name: Malyn

texts.en:
Malyn is 39 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. She is from the village of Burgos, in the province of Isabela. Malyn owns and operates a business venture in the community providing a motorcycle with a passenger cab. 

Malyn is requesting a loan of PHP 23,000 to purchase spare parts for her motocycle, such as tires and oil, to offer a better quality of service to the people of the community. Malyn has been in her business for over 18 years and earns approximately PHP 6,000 (Philippine pesos) per month. Malyn is a very patient and responsible person; not only for her family, but also in their community.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the motorcyle used in her business, such as tires and oil.

loans.name: Sovuthy's Group

texts.en:
Sovuthy is 36 years old, single and residing in a rural village of Pursat province’s Krokor district, Cambodia. He is a diligent and hard-working man who farms rice as his main business and he supplements his income by raising pigs and also planting spices on the site. Having been in the business for ten years, he is able to earn about 20,000 KHR per day from his current business. 

This is the first micro loan for Sovuthy’s group of two members with VisionFund. He and his other member are applying for a loan of 600,000 KHR and 200,000 KHR each. As the leader, he will use his portion to buy pig feed. He hopes to feed his pigs to be healthy and fat and also hopes to increase his current business so as to earn a larger income to improve his living condition.

loans.use: to buy pig feed

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa is a 55-year-old married woman. She has seven grown children. She describes herself as patient, quiet, and responsible. 

Jesusa is a vegetable vendor in the community. She has been involved in this business for ten years. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the loss of products due to the perishable nature of goods. 

Jesusa will use the PHP 12,000 loan to add to her stock of potatoes, onions, tomatoes, and cabbages. She hopes that within five years, she will be able to educate her children to high levels.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, onions, tomatoes, and cabbages to sell.

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: Touch is a 30-year-old resident of a rural village in the Bakan district located in Pursat province, Cambodia. She is married and a mother of two dependent children, all of whom are school-aged children. To offer a decent life for the family, Touch and her husband work as rice farmers on a hectare of farmland. Touch’s husband also has a business catching fish in order to supplement the income. This couple is able to earn around 14,000 KHR per day and save approximately 7,000 KHR after the daily expenses. This will be Touch’s third time requesting a loan via VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The previous loans have enabled her to improve the family’s living conditions. Touch is now seeking a 1,500,000 KHR loan to buy fertilizer, pesticides and rice-seed. After receiving and wisely using the requested loan portion, Touch believes that the rice-growing business will provide good quality crop yields so that she can sell it for more and increase her income. She will utilize the anticipated income to move the family ahead and further educate her beloved children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides and rice-seed

loans.name: Al-Bostan Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Bostan and consists of five ladies and man who live in Taiz, Yemen. 

Mithaq is 32 years old and a married woman. She is a housewife and owns a small house.

She is requesting a loan of 20,000 YER from AMB to cover the cost of purchasing construction supplies such as cement and sand for her home

loans.use: to buy construction supplies such as cement and sand for her home.

loans.name: Brigilda

texts.en: Brigilda is a 39-year-old woman who sells various products in the community located in the village of Burgos, province of Isabela. She has ten years of experience in this field. Brigilda is married and has two grown-up children. Her monthly income from this business is PHP 3,000. The types of products she sells are very popular and in high demand. She would like to expand her business and purchase more items and diversify the products she sells. For this purpose she applied for a PHP 15,000 loan. She has already demonstrated herself to be a good client with a positive credit history.

loans.use: to buy milk, coffee, sugar, soap, noodles and spices for her store.

loans.name: Chem

texts.en:
Chem is 21 years old, and married with an eight-month-year-old daughter. She lives with her husband in Chbar Mon district, Kompong Speu province.

Chem was employed at a nearby garment factory that’s 3km from her house, generating a normal salary to add to her spouse’s main income. She had been doing this for the past two years. After giving birth to her daughter, Chem temporarily stays at home taking care of her baby instead of working. 

During this interval of time, Chem could better establish a  hog-raising business to stabilize her income. However, she has insufficient income to start it.  For this reason, she is asking for a loan in the amount of $1,500 USD to build a piggery, and purchase pigs and piglets for raising. 

For the future, Chem plans to keep expanding her hog-raising business and own a big pig farm in her neighborhood. This way, she will be able to attain a better quality of life by being a successful, independent entrepreneur.

loans.use: to build a piggery, and purchase pigs and piglets for raising.

loans.name: Phon

texts.en:
Phon is 53 years old. She is married, and resides with three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a homemaker. Her husband runs a taxi service (motor taxi) and makes an income of $6 daily. Her children are employed in a garment factory. They earn about $9 each day. 

Due to a lack of funds, Phon is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase timber to build a fence around her house. By doing so, she would gain high security for her family. 

In the future, she would like to run a tailoring shop so her children can work at home in order to generate more income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase timber to build a fence around her house.

loans.name: Kun

texts.en:
Kun is 29 years old and lives in Krong Chbar Mon in Kompong Speu province. She owns a house where she lives with her husband and a small kid. Kun is a housewife who is very careful to take care of her family while her husband works as a driver for a private company. Once a month, he together with his boss goes on a mission to another province and stays there for a few days. The income mainly depends on her husband. 

Kun would like to have a loan through HKL, a longstanding Kiva partner, to renovate her house, which is partly decayed due to age. She will pay for the construction costs and purchase needed materials for her house. With the positive impact of the loan, Kun surely believes that she will have a suitable house that satisfies her living needs. In the future, Kun plans to have a general store where she can launch her commercial activities and better her income.

loans.use: to renovate her house

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda is from the village of Burgos. She is 54 years old. Erlinda is married and has three adult children. To make a living, she owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling cosmetics and apparel products from AVON and Natasha Company in the local community. Erlinda has been engaged in her business for over three years. Erlinda is requesting a loan of 26,000 PHP to purchase additional products such as clothes, pants and make-up. Her goal is to continue working and increase her profits, so that she can have a good life in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional products for her business.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is a married father of four children who range in age from 12 to 18. He lives with his family in northeast Albania. 

For more than 10 years, Martin has been involved in the animal husbandry business, and has managed to nurture this activity throughout the years.
He sells milk and little calves to locals. 

Even so, his is the only income in the family, but it hasn't been bad after all, says Martin. “It’s  hard work, no doubt about it, yet it can turn out to be profitable if there are no natural disasters such as heavy snow and flooding that hits the region sometimes and cause the unfortunate death of animals,” Martin continued saying.

He applied for a loan recently through VisionFund Albania to make some major repairs to his existing animal stable, and hopes that Kiva lenders will help him financially through their lending.

loans.use: To make major repairing to his animals' existing stable

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita operates a grocery shop. She is married to a farmer and has one child. She is engaged in selling a variety of products, and she also sells rice in their village. Lolita has been operating this grocery shop for six years now. With her income, she supports her husband to feed their children. 

She will use her loan to purchase bags of rice and a variety of grocery items to satisfy her customers. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase rice, snack foods, drinks, spices and canned goods for her business.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Chea is a 59-year-old woman who has been working as a farmer for the past 32 years. She is very industrious and honest in her daily work at the rice field. During November to December, her harvests are ripe and she is busy with harvesting her crops. Also, she needs to hire local laborers to help her in collecting and transporting her rice products from the fields. Chea is a widow and has five children, living with two of them in Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province.

Chea is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD in order to start up a grocery store from her own house, where she sells general products such snacks, sweets, ingredients, beverages, shampoos, kitchen supplies and other items. Through this new business, Chea hopes to increase her income and save it for future of her business and family.

loans.use: to start up a grocery store from her own house, where she sells general products such snacks, sweets, ingredients, beverages, shampoos, kitchen supplies and other items.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en: Rosalia is married and is the loving mother of her children. She is a well-mannered and conscientious person. She has been involved in fattening pigs for over three years. Her husband helps her with this business, and looks after and feeds the livestock when she goes to the market to buy more livestock. She wants to expand her business and maximize her profits in order to provide for her family and place her children into schools. Rosalia wants to obtain a loan in the sum of PHP 10,000 for the purchase of feed and vitamins and increasing turnover. She is grateful to all creditors for their help and mercy.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Touch is 50 years old and lives with her spouse and children in Prey Chor District, Kompong Cham Province. 

Touch is a farmer who owns and manages a few plots of rice farms. She has been in this business for more than 30 years, earning an appropriate income to nourish her family. Touch wants to help her family to increase its income and experience a better quality of life.

In order to go ahead in her business, Touch would like to have financial support from Kiva and HKL to pay for labor costs incurred in harvesting her rice crops. She will use the remaining funds to purchase grocery items for selling in order to boost her profit. 

In the future, Touch wishes to renovate and decorate her house, so that she can provide a comfortable living to the whole family.

loans.use: to pay for labor costs incurred in harvesting her rice crops.

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en:
Elenita, 53, lives in the town of Naguillan, a province of Isabela. Elenita works hard to support the needs of her children. Her husband is a farmer and they help each other to achieve their dream for their children. 

Elenita is a vegetable vendor. She is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy different vegetables that she can sell in the community. She dreams that someday she will have her own store and provide a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for her business.

loans.name: Lagrimas

texts.en: Lagrimas, 49 years old, is engaged in the business of raising pigs in her village. Through the business, she is aspiring to a better life. But, without working capital, no business will perform well, and it will definitely not produce a good income that will lead to a better life. Therefore, Lagrimas is applying for additional capital to use in her business. A loan of PHP 15,000 will be use to buy feeds, vitamins and medicine. She believes that, through the loan, she can improve her income and attain her goals in life.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and medicine for her pigs.

loans.name: Primitiva

texts.es: La Sra.  Primitiva tiene 41 años, tiene tres hijos de las edades de 19, 15  y 12 años, todos  se encuentran estudiando,   La Sra.  Primitiva se dedica a la venta de variedad de artículos de primera necesidad como abarrotes, dulces, refrescos y variedad de artículos en su tienda de barrio,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, La Sra.  Primitiva va a usar este préstamo para la compra variedad de abarrotes para surtir su negocio como arroz, fideo, harina y azúcar por mayor para surtir su tienda   y  de esta manera brindar variedad de productos a sus clientes,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, La Sra.  Primitiva va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando productos y así mejorando sus ingresos, su deseo para su negocio es tener un almacén y así brindar un  mejor servicio a su clientela. La Sra.  Primitiva es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada ya que esta es la única actividad que le permite mantener a su familia.
texts.en: Primitiva is 41, she has three children ages 19, 15 and 13, they are all students; Primitiva sells basic need products such as groceries, candy, soda and a variety of products from her neighbourhood store.  This loan is her first sequence with the institution, Primitiva is going to use this loan to buy a variety of groceries to stock her business such as rice, pasta, flour and sugar at wholesale to stock the store and this way provide a good variety of products to her customers.  Her reason to request the loan is to improve her business, Primitiva is going to use the benefits to keep buying products and increase her income, her wish for the business is to have a warehouse and continue to provide the best service to her customer.  Primitiva is a very hardworking person and feels very happy about the opportunity provided to her because this is the only activity that allows her to support her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of groceries to stock her business such as rice, pasta, flour and sugar at wholesale.

loans.name: Karina Adilia Karlota

texts.es:
La señora Karina Adilia Karlota esta casada, tiene 21 años de edad, cursó sus estudios de educación primaria, tiene un hijo pequeño, se dedica al tejido de cortes típicos, inicio este negocio gracias al apoyo de su mamá, que la apoyo en pagar su aprendizaje y luego fue operaria por un tiempo, y le dio un poco de capital para los insumos necesarios, para este trabajo y tener su propio negocio, hasta el momento lleva 6 años de experiencia, y le ido muy bien, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica como ayudante de camión.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de hilos y labores de diferentes colores y diseños, para poder incrementar su volumen de producción de tejidos y tener mas posibilidades de atraer clientes y vender mas, en el futuro espera tener un negocio amplio, con varios telares y trabajadores.
texts.en:
Karina Adilia Karlota, 21, is married and has a small son. She went to primary school and now knits traditional clothes. She started this line of work thanks to her mother’s support, since she paid for her training. She worked as a machine operator for some time, which helped her build some capital to buy supplies and to start her own business. She has now six years of experience and does very well. Her husband, who works as a bus attendant, supports her.

Karina is requesting a loan to buy threads and decorative embroidery of different sizes and designs, in order to increase her production and have more possibilities to attract customers and sell more. She wants to have a large establishment in the future, with several looms and several employees.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her weaving business.

loans.name: Bayarmaa

texts.en:
Bayarmaa is a 45-year-old married woman who operates a jewelry selling business at the largest outdoor market of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia.  She has two daughters and both of them are married. Bayarmaa's husband works as a wood engraver at local company. 

Bayarmaa has experience in a stall business. She has been operating her stall business since 1997, and at the largest outdoor market since 2000. 
 
Now it is the holiday season; thus, she wants to purchase more jewelry to sell during the Christmas and New Year season.

loans.use: to purchase more jewelry to sell during the New Year holiday.

loans.name: Chuluunsuren

texts.en:
Chuluunsuren is a 30-year-old pharmacist who lives with her son and spouse in the outer district of the city. Besides her current work, she has also specialized as a hardware engineer.  

She has worked in a few pharmacies in the city, but now she works at her father’s pharmacy and she also rents a small grocery store. She wants to increase the variety of products for sale in her store. 

Mongolia has four seasons, and now it is the very cold and changeable winter season. She would like to purchase more medicines in order to protect citizens from many kinds of flu and other ailments and to increase her grocery store's working capital.

loans.use: to increase the number of medicines she has available for sale and to purchase products to sell in her grocery store.

loans.name: Belen

texts.en: Belen’s eatery business provides her family's daily basis costs. She has been in this business for over two years and she wishes to expand her business.  She could be able to do this if she had stable funds to use. To make it possible, she is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy vegetables, meat, hotdogs and longganisa to cook. She hopes that her wish to expand her little eatery business will be achieved soon.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, hotdogs and longganisa

loans.name: Soeurn

texts.en:
Soeurn is 45 years old. She is married with two children. They are both attending school. Soeurn will support them until they graduate from a university and have a good salary. 

For 27 years, Soeurn has been dedicated to the farming business, growing rice on her inherited farmland located in Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. Aside from working in the fields, Soeurn helps her husband to provide a rice-mill service from their home.

Soeurn is requesting a loan through HKL to purchase a couple of cows for the maintenance of the rice fields. Soeurn is glad for the given funds; with them, she will be able to manage the business efficiently. She hopes to reduce her costs and improve her outputs in the coming season.

loans.use: to purchase cows for the maintenance of the rice fields.

loans.name: Micaela

texts.es:
La señora Micaela es madre soltera, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 4 hijos de los cuales 3 están estudiando, se dedica al comercio a la venta de leña, inicio este negocio `por necesidad de obtener un ingreso para sustentarse y apoyar a su familia, hasta el momento lleva 23 años de experiencia.

Solicita un préstamo que le servirá para la compra de arboles grandes para extraer madera, la cual ella lo utiliza para sacar la leña que vende, espera seguir trabajando y mejorando, ya que en el futuro, espera tener una bodega de madera, de diferente usos y vender tablas, reglas, machimbre ,etc.
texts.en:
Mrs. Micaela is a single mother of four children; three of them attend school. She could not study herself.

Micaela sells firewood. She started this business because she needed to have an income to pay for her expenses and support her family. She has twenty-three years of experience.

She is requesting a loan to buy big lumbers in order to extract the wood she sells. She hopes to be able to continue working and in the future, she wants to have a warehouse to store different types of wood and to sell dimensional lumbers, tongue and groove lumbers and frames, among other things.

loans.use: to buy firewood to sell.

loans.name: Maria Sabina

texts.es:
La señora Maria Sabina es viuda, tiene 47 años de edad, cursó los grados de educacion primaria, tiene 2 hijos de los cuales 1 estudia, se dedica al comercio a la atención a una tienda de artículos de consumo, inicio este negocio con un mínimo de capital y hasta el momento lleva 20 años de experiencia.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de productos para surtir su tienda, compra de aguas gaseosas, jugos, comida enlatada, fideos, azúcar, golosinas, etc. Espera en el futuro tener una abarroteria para distribuir productos a otras tiendas.
texts.en:
Maria Sabina is 47 years old and a widow. In school she went as far as the primary grades, and has two children, of whom one goes to school. She has a grocery store business. She started this business with a small amount of capital, and so far has 20 years of experience.

She is applying for a loan that she will use to purchase products for stocking her store, such as soft drinks, juices, canned foods, noodles, sugar, candy, etc. Someday she hopes to have a grocery business that distributes products to other stores.

loans.use: To buy products for her store.

loans.name: 33- Alamos Group

texts.es: El Banco de Emprendimiento 33- ALAMOS está compuesta por ocho integrantes de los cuales seis  son mujeres y dos varones que se dedican a distintas actividades, la presidenta del banco es la  Sra. Janeth tiene 25 años, tiene 1 hijo que tiene la edad de 3 años,  se dedica a la venta de comida  una zona muy concurrida de la ciudad de Cochabamba,   Este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución la  Sra. Janeth va a usar este préstamo para Invertir en la compra de insumos para la elaboración de sus comidas, como arroz, fideo, papa y aceite por mayor Su razón para solicitar este préstamo por la falta de capital, la  Sra. Janeth enfrenta retos en su negocio ya que los  precios han subido y muchas veces los insumos  escasean y va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir comprando insumos, para la elaboración de sus comidas, la  Sra. Janeth es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo  brindado.
texts.en: The “33-Alamos” communal bank has 8 members; six women and two men who carry out a variety of activities.  The bank president is Janeth, 25; she has a 3-year-old son.  She works selling food in a very busy part of the city of Cochabamba.  This loan is her first sequence in the institution and Janeth will use it to buy ingredients like rice, noodles, potatoes and oil at wholesale needed for her food preparation.  Her reason for requesting this loan is the lack of capital.  The business challenge Janeth faces is that prices have risen and ingredients often are scarce.  She will use profits to continue buying ingredients for food preparation.   Janeth is a very hardworking person who feels happy and grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Mirna Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora Mirna tiene 40 años de edad, es casada y tiene tres hijos, uno de 18, otro de 15 y el menor de 12 años de edad respectivamente. Ella cuenta con más de tres años administrando su propia tienda de productos básicos: como gaseosas, golosinas, maíz, fríjol, aceite, pan dulce y pan francés, etc. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar más mercadería para su tienda al por mayor y la otra parte la invertirá en la compra de una ternera para engordarla. De esta manera, espera ahorrarse un buen dinero al comprar por mayor, por lo que tendrá más mercadería disponible y venderá más  recibiendo más ingresos. 

Su mayor deseo es convertir su tienda en la líder de la comunidad, en donde vive y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Mirna is 40 years old and married. She has three children - one of them is 18 years old, another one is 15 and the youngest one is 12 years old. For over three years she has been running her own store where she sells household staples such as soft drinks, snacks, corn, beans, olive oil, sweet bread, French bread, etc.
The loan she's requesting from Fundación Campo is to purchase more wholesale merchandise for her store. She'll use the rest of it to purchase a calf for fattening. That way she hopes to save a good amount of money by buying wholesale items. Therefore she'll have more merchandise available, increase her sales and improve her profits.
Her biggest wish is to make hers the leading store in the community where she lives, and to see her children become professionals.

loans.use: to purchase more wholesale merchandise for her store, and in part to purchase a calf for fattening.

loans.name: Manuel Max

texts.en:
Manuel is a 23-year-old male living in Ica, Peru. Ica is the capital city of the Ica region, a desert coastal region to the west of the Andes Mountains. Manuel studied in a local university and is a tutor for elementary school students. Giving lessons out of his family home, he is trying to save up to become an environmental engineer.

Daily, Manuel tutors for 5-7 hours to students of all different levels.  However, despite the time commitment, it is difficult for Manuel to provide the kind of quality lessons he wants to give because of a lack of resources. He would like to obtain a Kiva loan in order to purchase materials for his students, be it an extra desk or more educational materials. He believes this loan will give him a better quality of life.

Manuel dreams of working for an oil company and eventually owning his very own house. He is very grateful to the lenders who enable him to continue pursuing his dreams.

loans.use: to purchase materials for his students

loans.name: Juan Victor

texts.es:
El señor Juan Victor esta soltero, tiene 28 años de edad, cursó los grados de educación diversificada, se dedica a la artesanía, es tejedor de cortes típicos, inicio este trabajo siendo trabajador con sus familiares y actualmente lleva 5 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su familia.

Solicita un préstamo, lo utilizara para la compra de hilos y tramos de diferentes colores para aumentar su producción de tejidos, espera mejorar su negocio y tener varios telares y trabajadores para su negocio, dando así la oportunidad a otros a superarse.
texts.en:
Sr. Juan Victor is 28 years old and single. He finished his education at a diversified school. Juan Victor is a craftsman who produces traditional woven skirts. He started out working with his relatives and now has five years of experience. Juan Victor has the support of his family.

He is requesting a loan in order to buy thread and elastics of different colors so that he can increase his production of woven goods. Juan Victor hopes to improve his business by acquiring several looms and employees. This will allow him to give others the opportunity to succeed.

loans.use: to buy thread and elastics of different colors.

loans.name: Ya Umu

texts.en:
This is 44-year-old Ya Umu.  She is married and has five children ages 25, 23, 20, 17 and 14 years old. All of them attend school.

In 1991, Ya Umu established her jeans, shirts, shoes, sandal, polo, lacoste, school bags, traveling bags, etc. business. She began her business because her father didn't value girls' education. Ya Umu was sent to school by her step-mother, but at class II, her father stopped her from going to school.  Her step-mother introduced her to business.  When Ya Umu became an adult, her parents gave her in marriage to a businessman who established a business for her.  Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, she earns about SLL 3,400,000 every month from her business. 

Ya Umu would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. She has already received and successfully repaid five loans, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase jeans, polos , blouses , shoes , and school bags . In the future, Ya Umu plans to open another outlet, to provide a quality education for her children, and to build another house. Fluctuation in foreign currency is affecting the prices of items. Ya Umu is hardworking and honest. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy clothing for her business

loans.name: Andres Abelino

texts.es:
El señor Andres Abelino esta casado, tiene 23 años de edad, curso los 3 años d educacion primaria, tiene 2 hijos de los cuales 1 esta estudiando, se dedica al comercio a la atención a una tienda en general, inicio este negocio gracias al apoyo de un familiar, lleva 2 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa quien se dedica al mismo trabajo.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizar  para la compra de productos, para surtir su tienda, quiere ver su negocios con mas productos, por eso va comprar, aguas gaseosas en diferentes sabores, jugos enlatados, fideos, golosinas, y demás productos con demanda, espera tener un negocio grande y con muchos clientes.
texts.en:
Andres Abelino, 23 years old, is married and has two children. One of them is in school, and Andres completed three years of primary school himself. He works in the commercial sector, attending to a general store. He started this business thanks to the support of a family member and now has two years of experience. He counts on help from his wife, who has the same job as him.

He is requesting a loan to buy products to stock his store. He wants his business to have more products; therefore, he is going to buy different flavors of carbonated water, canned juices, noodles, sweets, and other products that are in demand. He hopes to have a large business with many customers.

loans.use: to buy products

loans.name: Dario Daniel

texts.es: El Sr. Darío tiene 23 años, el se dedica  a la actividad de venta de calzados deportivos tiene su puesto de venta que se encuentra en la zona de Llojeta, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, el Sr. Dario va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de calzados por mayor   y así de esta manera brindar variedad de sus productos  a  sus clientes e incrementar sus ganancias ya que esta época de fin de año tiene mucha demanda,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la Sr. Darío va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando variedad de productos, Sr. Darío es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada ya que esta es la única fuente de ingresos con la que cuenta.
texts.en:
Darío, 23, makes a living selling athletic footwear.  He has a sales stall in the Llojeta area.

This loan is his first sequence with the institution.  Darío's going to use this loan to buy shoes wholesale.  This way he'll have a variety of products to offer his customers and increase his profits because there's a lot of demand during this season at the end of the year.  His reason for requesting this loan is to continue improving in his business.  Darío's going to use the profits to continue buying a variety of products.

Darío's a very hardworking person.  He's happy about this opportunity because this is his only source of income.

loans.use: to buy athletic shoes wholesale

loans.name: Serafina

texts.es: La Sra. Serafina tiene 48 años tiene 3 hijos que se encuentran estudiando, ella se dedica a la venta  de comida  en su puesto de venta se encuentran en uno de los mercados de la zona de Plan 3000,  Este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, La Sra. Serafina va a usar este préstamo para la compra de un Frízer que le hace falta para conservar los refrescos, las verduras y carnes para la elaboración de sus comidas,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de capital para la compra frízer. La Sra. Serafina enfrenta retos en su negocio que son crecer en clientela y va a utilizar los beneficios mejorar  la calidad de vida de su familia, ya que esta es la única actividad con la que cuentas.
texts.en:
Serafina is 48 years old and has three children who are all studying. She makes a living selling food. Her stall can be found in one of the markets in the zone "Plan 3000." This loan is her first loan cycle with the institution. Serafina will use this loan to purchase a freezer which she is missing. She will use it to  preserve the drinks, vegetables and meats that she uses to prepare food. The reason she is asking for this loan is because she is lacking the capital to buy a freezer.

Serafina faces the challenges of her business, which include gaining clientele. She will use the benefits of her work to improve the quality of life for her family, since this is the only activity that counts.

loans.use: to buy a freezer

loans.name: Griselda

texts.es: La Sra. Griselda  tiene 24 años tiene dos hijitos de las edades de 5 y 1 años,  ella se dedica  a la venta de ropa en una tienda que s encuentra en la zona de Chasquipampa al sur de la ciudad de la Paz es una zona muy alejada,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Griselda va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de una motocicleta ya que esto le permitirá movilizarse de manera rápida de su domicilio a su tienda ya que son distancias largas que tiene que recorrer,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en trabajo, la Sra. Griselda es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada  en la otorgación del crédito ya que esta es su única  actividad que le permite mantenerse.
texts.en: Señora Griselda is 24 years old. She has two little children, ages 5 and 1. She sells clothing in a store located in the Chasquipampa district south of the city of La Paz. It is a very remote area. This loan is her first one from this institution. Señora Griselda is going to use this loan to buy a motorcycle, since this will allow her to go more rapidly from her home to her store, since she has to cover long distances. Her reason for applying for this loan is to continue improving in her work. Señora Griselda is a very hard-working person. She feels happy about the opportunity offered to her with the granting of the loan, since this is her only business that enables her to support herself.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es: La Sra. Angelica  tiene 34 años y es casada con 4 hijos que son de las edades de 1, 5, 10 y 14 años, ella se dedica a la venta de enaguas y polleras  para mujeres de polleras, tu tienda se encuentran en la zona del Tejar,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro la institución, La Sra. Angelica  va a usar este préstamo para la compra enaguas y polleras por mayor para  surtir su negocio ya que por esta fechas que se acerca el aniversario del barrio y además las fiestas de fin de año  tiene mucha venta, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es incremento de capital de trabajo, La Sra. Angelica  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son surtir su mercadería y va a utilizar los beneficios e seguir comprando por mayor.
texts.en: Angelica is 34 years old and is married with 4 children who are aged 1, 5, 10 and 14 years old. She sells petticoats and skirts for women. Her store is located in Tejar zone. This loan is her first sequence with the institution. Angelica is going to use this loan to buy petticoats and skirts wholesale to supply her business since during these dates that are approaching is the anniversary of the neighborhood and in addition the end of year parties when she has many sales. Her reason for requesting this loan is to increase her working capital. Angelica faces challenges in her business which are to supply her merchandise and is going to use the profits and continue buying wholesale.

loans.use: to buy petticoats and skirts for women.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy weaving threads.

loans.name: Ana Melba

texts.es:
Ana tiene 36 años de edad, vive con su esposo y su hija que asiste al jardín de niños. Ella junto con su esposo tienen un año de dedicarse a la venta de verduras y frutas. El negocio les ha dado buenos resultados; poseen un vehiculo no en muy buenas condiciones, de vez en cuando les presenta problemas. Al vehiculo le han adapto unas varillas de hierro en donde ubican los huacales llenos de tomates, chiles, repollos, remolachas, etc. Recorren todas las calles de la comunidad hasta terminar la venta y lo hacen todos los días. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando es para comprar tomates, chiles, repollos, remolachas, etc. Debido a que se acerca la temporada navideña y necesita bastante mercadería para satisfacer a sus clientes.  Con la inversión, podrá obtener más ingresos económicos, logrando una estabilidad económica en su familia. Su propósito, es establecer una tienda en su casa y atenderla ella, para que su esposo salga a vender la fruta y verdura en el vehiculo.
texts.en:
Ana, 36, lives with her husband and her daughter who's in kindergarten.  She and her husband have been selling fruit for more than a year.

The business has given them good results.  They have a vehicle that's not in very good condition that occasionally gives them problems.  They have adapted some iron rods where they put the crates filled with tomatoes, chiles, cabbage, beets, etc.  Every day they go through all the streets of the community until they sell everything.

The loan she's requesting is to buy tomatoes, chiles, cabbage, beets, etc., because the Christmas season is approaching and she needs a lot of merchandise to satisfy her customers.  With the investment she'll be able to get more income and have financial stability in her family.

Her goal is to set up a store in her house and tend to it herself so her husband can go out to sell the fruits and vegetables in the car.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, chiles, cabbage, and beets

loans.name: Cinthya Priscila

texts.es:
Priscila es una joven de 26 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, la cual se caracteriza por ser una ciudad con muchos atractivos turísticos y sobre todo porque se encuentra en la linda selva peruana. Priscila vive al lado de sus padres, a quienes apoya mucho con el fruto de su trabajo ya que son de condición muy humilde.  Priscila es una joven muy trabajadora, con mucho esfuerzo logro estudiar la carrera de Enfermería técnica y gracias a ello labora en un pequeño centro médico en el cual cuidan y atienden a los adultos mayores. Día a día trabaja alrededor de 10 horas y ella cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy amable y responsable en su trabajo.

Priscila está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar materiales para poder realizar mejoras en su vivienda como madera, calaminas, entre otros; con lo cual podrá brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y seguir luchando cada día para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Terminar de construir su vivienda”
texts.en:
Priscila is a 26 year old youth. She lives in the city of Pucallpa, which is characterized to be a city with many attractive tourists and above all because it is located on the border of the Peruvian jungle. Priscila lives with her parents, who she supports very much with the fruit of her work since they are in very humble conditions. Priscila is a very hard-working youth, with much effort she succeeded in studying the career of technical nursing and thanks to it she works in a small medical center in which they care for and serve elderly adults. Day to day she works around 10 hours and she thinks that she is doing well in her work because she is very kind and responsible in her work.

Priscila is very grateful for the Kiva loans since thanks to the help that they offered her she will be able to buy materials to be able to make improvements in her housing such as wood, corrugated iron, among others, with which she will be able to offer a better quality of life to her family and continue striving each day to be able to realize her greatest dream: "To finish building her house."

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Las Magnificas Colca Group

texts.es: Banco de Emprendimiento LAS MAGNIFICAS COLCA está compuesta por ocho integrantes de los cuales seis  son mujeres y dos varones que se dedican a distintas actividades, la presidenta del banco es la  Sra. Treysi tiene 23 años, tiene dos hijos de las edades de 2 y 5 años, Sra. Treysi se dedica a la venta de variedad de artículos de primera necesidad como abarrotes, dulces, refrescos y variedad de artículos en su tienda de barrio,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, Sra. Treysi va a usar este préstamo para la compra variedad de abarrotes para surtir su negocio como arroz, fideo, harina y azúcar por mayor para surtir su tienda  y  de esta manera brindar variedad de productos a sus clientes,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, Sra. Treysi va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando productos y así mejorando sus ingresos, ya que esta época es de mucha demanda,  su deseo para su negocio es tener un almacén y así brindar un  mejor servicio a su clientela. Sra. Treysi es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada a ella y a sus compañeras de grupo
texts.en: The venture bank LAS MAGNIFICAS COLCA is comprised of eight members, including six women and two men that are engaged in various activities. The president of the bank is 23 year old Treysi, who has two children who are 2 and 5 years old. Tresyi works to sell a variety of items like groceries, candy, soft drinks and other items in her local shop. This loan is the first sequence within the institution. Treysi is going to use the loan to buy a variety of groceries for her business like rice, pasta, flour and sugar in bulk to stock her store and thus provide a variety of products to her customers. Her reason for soliciting the loan is to continue improving her business. Treysi will use the profits to continue purchasing products and thus improve her income, since during this season there is great demand. She wants to have a warehouse and thus provide better service to her customers. Treysi is a hardworking person and feels happy for the opportunities provided to her and her group members.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock their store.

loans.name: Maritza Fiorella

texts.en:
A native of Nazca, Peru, Maritza is a very hard-working young woman. She completed her primary education in Peru, and then began working. She currently works 11 hours a day in a restaurant as she tries to make ends meet. In addition to her work, she is responsible and attentive to her customers.

She began working in the restaurant out of necessity, but now she has a desire to start her own business. She would like to test her entrepreneurial skills by selling clothes and Christmas toys to her neighbors and work colleagues. If she feels confident in her abilities as a business woman and salesperson, she would like to start a business.

Maritza dreams of having a better life, and is willing to put in the hours to get there. She thanks her Kiva lenders for giving her a chance to give herself a better life.

loans.use: to sell clothes and Christmas toys to her neighbors and work colleagues.

loans.name: Marjorie Monserrate

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres Trabajadoras. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.

En este lugar vive la  señora Maryorie, tiene 37 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 17, 13 y 11 años, los  dos  mayores estudian en colegio y el menor en escuela. Su marido trabaja en una camaronera. 

Ella es una muy buena ama de casa que además de dedicarse al hogar y la atención de su familia también se dedica a la preparación y venta de comida, ella prepara desayunos y almuerzos los mismos que vende en su casa donde tiene unas mesas y sillas para sus clientes que llegan a servirse sus deliciosos platos, antes solo  entregaba los almuerzos a domocilio pero poco a poco y con la ayuda de los créditos fue adecuando un pequeño restaurante. Con este negocio ella se gana lo suficiente para solventar los gastos de sus hijos.

Este crédito es para comprar arroz, carne, plátano, maní y otros víveres para la preparación de los alimentos. Esta desde el inicio  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque el grupo es muy unido y responsable. 

Su sueño es que sus hijos sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
The members of the communal bank "Mujeres Trabajadores" (Working Women) meet every two weeks in the Rocafuerte canton. This place is known for its delicious sweets that the local residents prepare and that are known throughout the country.

In this place lives Señora Marjorie. She is 37 years old and is in a long-term relationship from which she has three children, ages 17, 13, and 11. The two older ones are in secondary school, and the youngest is in primary school. Her husband works on a shrimp farm.

She is a good homemaker who in addition to working at home and tending to the family also prepares and sells food. She prepares breakfasts and lunches that she sells in her house, where she has some tables and chairs for her customers who arrive to be served her delicious dishes. Before she only delivered the lunches, but little by little and with the help of the loans, she went about setting up a little restaurant. With this business she earns enough to pay the expenses of her children.

This loan is to buy rice, meat, bananas, peanuts, and other supplies to prepare food.  She has been in the communal bank since its beginning, and she likes it because the group is very united and responsible.

Her dream is for her children to have good careers.

loans.use: to buy rice, meat, bananas, peanuts, and other supplies

loans.name: Johana Elizabeth

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Virgen Del Mar se reúne cada 15 días en el hermoso balneario de San Mateo en la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, en  este lugar la mayoría de los habitantes se dedica a la pesca y a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar vive la señora Johana, tiene 31 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 10, 8 y 3 años de edad, los mayores estudian en  escuela. Su esposo chofer y comerciante.

Doña Johana para ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta. También su esposo trae materiales de pesca para vender a comerciantes de este lugar o directamente a pescadores de la zona.  Tanto ella como su esposo trabajan todos los días el con sus transportes y venta de materiales de pesca y ella con la venta de ropa, ella deja a crédito a sus clientes y cobra los fines de semana. Lleva tres años en esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y materiales para la pesca. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 2 años y le gusta por la ayuda que recibe con los créditos.
 
Su sueño es tener un carro para realizar sus ventas.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Virgen del Mar” meets every 15 days at the beautiful seaside resort of San Mateo in the city of Manta. This city is known for its beautiful beaches that are frequented throughout the year by local and foreign tourists. Most of the residents work in the fishing industry or have jobs that are related to the sea.

Sra. Johana lives in this place. She is 31 years old, married, and has three children (ages 10, 8, and 3). The older children attend school. Her husband works as a chauffeur and a merchant.

Doña Johana earns some money on her own so that she can help her husband with the household expenses. She sells clothing of all types by going door-to-door. Her husband also brings in fishing supplies that are sold either to local merchants or directly to the fishermen in the area. Both Johana and her husband work every day whether it be providing transportation, selling fishing supplies, or selling clothes. She extends credit to her customers and collects payment on the weekends. Johana has been in this business for three years and is doing very well.

The loan she will receive will be used to buy more merchandise such as trousers, blouses, and T-shirts, as well as fishing supplies. She has been with the Communal Bank for two years and enjoys the assistance she has received through the loans.

Her dream is to have a car that she can use for making sales.

loans.use: to buy trousers, blouses, and T-shirts to sell as well as fishing supplies for her husband's business.

loans.name: Dolores Elizabeth

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres Trabajadoras. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.

En este lugar vive la señora Dolores, tiene 31 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la tienen dos hijos de 10 y 9 años que estudian en escuela. Su marido es agricultor.
 
Ella es una muy buena esposa y madre que para ayudar a su marido en sus actividades realiza el crédito para que él lo utilice en sus cultivos, él se dedica a sembrar plátanos y cocos en toda época del año, en la actualidad están arreglando unas parcelas para sembrar arroz, maíz y verduras, es para eso que él necesita el crédito para pagar mano de obra de los arreglos de dichas parcelas además de semillas, insecticidas y fertilizantes con la finalidad de obtener una muy buena cosecha y así asegurar buenos ingresos para sacar adelante con su familia.

Este crédito es para comprar semillas, abonos  químicos y fertilizantes, y pagar la mano de obra. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio y le gusta por la ayuda que recibe del banco. 

Su sueño es tener una buena cosecha.
texts.en:
The members of the Communal Bank “Mujeres Trabajadoras” (Working Women) meet every 15 days in the canton of Rocafuerte. This place is known for its delicious sweets that are prepared by the locals and are known all over the country.

Sra. Dolores lives in this place. She is 31 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has two children (ages 10 and 9) who are in school. Her husband is a farmer. Dolores is a good wife and mother who helps her husband with his activities. She is requesting a loan for her husband to use for maintaining his crops. He cultivates bananas and coconuts throughout the entire year. At the moment, he is preparing a few parcels of land for planting rice, corn, and vegetables. He needs the money to pay for labor for preparing the land. Her husband will also buy seeds, insecticides, and fertilizers so that he can obtain a good harvest and continue generating a good income that will help their family move forward.

This loan will be used to buy seeds, composting chemicals, and fertilizers, as well as pay for labor. Dolores has been with the Communal Bank from the beginning and enjoys the assistance she receives from the Bank. Her wish is to have a good harvest.

loans.use: to buy seeds, composting chemicals, and fertilizers, as well as pay for labor.

loans.name: Paola Katherine

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Virgen Del Mar se reúne cada 15 días en el hermoso balneario de San Mateo en la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, en  este lugar la mayoría de los habitantes se dedica a la pesca y a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar vive la señora Paola, tiene 29 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 6 y de 2 años  de edad, el mayor esta en primero de básica. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.

Doña Paola es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas), su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y trabaja tres días a la semana. Ella lleva cinco años dedicada a este negocio. Ella también utiliza el crédito para comprar material de pesca como redes, arpones, combustible y otros materiales para que su esposo la utilice ya que él tiene una pequeña embarcación en la que todos los días se dedica a estas faenas de pesca. Lleva más de 5 años con su negocio.

Este crédito es para comprar ropa de todo tipo, perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y materiales de pesca. Lleva 5 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por los bajos intereses que le cobran por los créditos.

Su sueño es tener otra lancha para su esposo ya que la que tienen es muy pequeña.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Virgen del Mar” meets every 15 days at the beautiful seaside resort of San Mateo in the city of Manta. This city is known for its beautiful beaches that are frequented throughout the year by local and foreign tourists. Most of the residents work in the fishing industry or have jobs that are related to the sea.
