Linda makes her sales as an itinerant vendor and lives in the community of San Lorenzo, in the south of Honduras.

Linda is requesting a loan to buy shirts, blouses, pants (trousers), underpants, dresses, skirts, sandals and shoes.  She will also buy pigs for her second business.  She has a lot of advance orders for this Christmas season.

Linda has orders for tamales and clothing which is why she is requesting this loan to invest in her business.  With the profits she makes from her sales, she would like to be able to continue working and improving her business.

Linda's dream is to continue working so that she can improve her home.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - November 2012

loans.use: to buy shirts, blouses, pants, underpants, dresses, skirts, sandals and shoes. She will also buy pigs to slaughter

loans.name: Eleuterio

texts.es:
Don Eleuterio tiene 58 años de edad, esta acompañado y tiene cuatro hijos. Desde su niñez, se ha dedicado a la agricultura sus ingresos los recibe por la venta de los productos que cosecha. Esta actividad la desempeña con gran capacidad y experiencia por los años que tiene desarrollándola. A demás, posee una pequeña tienda instalada en su casa de la cual recibe otros ingresos y una granja de cerdos.

Los productos los compra en el pueblo más cercano que esta a ocho kilómetros de su vivienda, el acceso a ese lugar es bastante difícil debe caminar entre una hora a una hora y media; pues no llega transporte hasta ese lugar y el traslado de la mercadería es bastante complicado. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar azúcar, arroz, fríjol, aceite, entre otros productos de la canasta básica y otra parte para comprar alimento para sus cerdos. Con la inversión, podrá comprar mercadería en cantidades más grandes para no tener que viajar tan seguido y ahorrarse un dinerito por comprar al por mayor y con el alimento para sus cerdos, los podrá alimentar muy bien para venderlos en corto tiempo, cuando estén bien desarrollados.

Su deseo es mejorar su calidad de vida, para brindar a su familia, salud, educación, vestuario, alimentación. En la medida en que su negocio mejore lo podrá lograr; además pretende proporcionar el estudio a sus hijos, ya que a él no se le presento esa oportunidad.
texts.en:
Eleuterio is 58 years old and has four children. Since his childhood, he has been dedicated to agriculture and has earned his income through the sale of his harvest. He preforms this activity with great ability and experience developed over the years. He also has a small shop in his home which provides income as well as a pig farm.

The products are bought in a nearby town 8 kilometer from his home. Access to the town quite difficult and to walk it takes between and hour and an hour and a half. Since he does not have his own transportation, the transfer of merchandise is quite complicated.

He is requesting this loan from Fundación Campo to buy sugar, rice, beans, oil, and other staples, and to buy food for his pigs. With the investment, he will be able to buy merchandise in large quantities and avoid having to travel so often. He will also save money by purchasing the pig feed at wholesale. He will be able to feed them well and sell them in a short time, when they are developed.

His desire is to improve his quality of life, to provide for his family and their health, education, clothing, and food. As his business improves, he will be able to achieve this. He aims to provide his children the chance to go further in school, as he was not given the opportunity.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, beans, oil, and other staples and to buy food for his pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy shoes, sandals, slippers, etc.

loans.name: Maria Alejandra

texts.es: La señora Maria Alejandra, habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe,  junto a su esposo, trabajan duro para poder mantener su  hogar y darle buenas condiciones a su hijo, uno se sus mayores sueños es terner su casi bonita, su dificultas es que no pueden recaudar todo el dinero de u na sola vez para comprar materiales, pero Gracias a Afodenic y Fondos Kiva quienes les han brindado apoyo comprara los siguientes Materiales: Arena, Piedrin, Cemento, Bloques, Hierro,etc. Agradecen el apoyo y confianza que se les esta brindando con este credito.
texts.en:
Maria Alejandra lives in the municipality of Ticuantepe with her husband. She works hard to keep up her home and to provide good conditions for her child. One of her greatest dreams is to have a pretty home. This has been difficult because they could not raise all of the money at once to buy materials.

Thanks to Afodenic and Kiva funds, they will be able to buy the following materials: sand, gravel, cement, blocks, iron, etc. They are grateful for the support and confidence that is being offered with this loan.

loans.use: to buy materials for construction.

loans.name: Rosseli Glend

texts.es:
Rosseli is a 30 year old woman who lives in Nazca, Peru. Nazca is the home of the famed Nazca Lines, some of the most impressive geoglyphs in the world, and the desert region boasts plenty of other cultural attraction. Rosseli is very hard-working to support herself and her seven year old son. In her spare time, Rosseli enjoys drawing and likes graphic design.

In Nazca, she works in a printing shop that has services for all paper needs, including stationary design, and even embroiders polo shirts. She is very knowledgeable in her trade and is excellent at recruiting clients. She has asked for a loan so that she may buy extra polo shirts for a Christmas campaign. The extra income from selling these shirts can help Rosseli achieve her dream of owning his own print and design shop.
texts.en:
Rosseli is a 30 year old woman who lives in Nazca, Peru. Nazca is the home of the famed Nazca Lines, some of the most impressive geoglyphs in the world, and the desert region boasts plenty of other cultural attraction. Rosseli is very hard-working and supports herself and her seven year old son. In her spare time, Rosseli enjoys drawing and likes graphic design.

In Nazca, she works in a printing shop that has services for all paper needs, including stationary design, and even embroiders polo shirts. She is very knowledgeable in her trade and is excellent at recruiting clients.

She has asked for a loan so that she may buy extra polo shirts for a Christmas campaign. The extra income from selling these shirts can help Rosseli achieve her dream of owning his own print and design shop.

loans.use: to buy more polos for stamping and embroidery for the Christmas campaign.

loans.name: Dionisio

texts.es: el Señor Dionisio Agricultor toda su vida, trabajador muy responsable, su esposa e hijos le apoyan en todas sus decisiones y trabajan juntos para poder formar un mejor futuro, actualmente  requiere de dinero ya que necesita darle mantenimiento a sus cultivos de Pitahaya y Piña, para que su produccion sea aun mejor. con este credito comprara lo necesario para fortalezer sus siembros: Urea, Triple 20, Refrescante, Completo 15-15-15, fertilizante, etc. Gracias al apoyo de la Financiera Afodenic y Fondos Kiva lograr comprar sus insumos.
texts.en: Dionisio has been a farmer all his life. He is a very responsible worker. His wife and children support him in all of his decisions, and they work together so that they can achieve a better future. Currently, he needs money since he needs to carry out maintenance on his pineapple and pitahaya [dragon fruit] crops, so that his production will be even better. With this loan, he will buy the necessary supplies to strengthen his crops: urea, Triple 20, refresher, complete 15-15-15, fertilizer, etc. Thanks to the support from the Afodenic institution and the Kiva fund, he will be able to buy his supplies.

loans.use: to buy supplies to maintain his crops.

loans.name: Arnulfo Jose

texts.es: El señor Arnulfo Habitante de la zona de Ticuantepe, casado padre de 2 niños, trabaja para una empresa privada en la Managua, su esposa comerciante desde hace 3 años, sueñan con darles un mejor provenir a sus hijos y mejorar de condiciones en el hogar entre los dos se dividen los gastos, pero se las hace muy complicado recaudar de una sola vez el dinero para comprar los materiales y terminar de construir su casa. Con este nuevo financiamiento comprar los siguientes Materiales: Cemento, Arena, Hierro, Piedrin, Ceramica, Bondex, etc. El señor Arnulfo Agradece el Apoyo brindado por Afodenic y Fondos Kiva.
texts.en: Señor Arnulfo lives in the Ticuantepe zone.  He is married and the father of two children.  He works for a private business in Managua.  His wife has been working as a saleswoman for three years.  They hope to give their children a better future and to improve the condition of their home.  Señor Arnulfo and his wife split the household expenses between them, but it has been very difficult for them to put together enough money to purchase the materials they need to finish construction on their house.  With this new loan, they will purchase the following materials: cement, sand, iron, gravel, tile, Bondex, etc.  Señor Arnulfo is grateful for the help he has been offered by Afodenic and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.es: El señor Alexander, junto a su esposa e hijo habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe, su mayor sueño es mejorar de vida y darle un buen futuro a su familia, dedicado al comercio desde hace varios años, con el apoyo de Afodenic a logrado aumentar su inventari y a crecido mas su negocio, actualmetne quiere aprovechar las ventas de esta temporada alta para que sus ingresos mejoren un poco con este dinero comprara ropa para Damas y Caballeros, ropa interior para damas y caballeros para ofrecer diversidad a sus clientes, Agradece el apoyo a Afodenic en conjunto a Fondos  Kiva le han brindado
texts.en: Señor Alexander, together with his wife and son, lives in the municipality of Ticuantepe.  His greatest dream is to improve his quality of life and to give a better future to his family.  He has made his living as a salesman for several years.  With help from Afodenic, he has been able to increase his inventory, and his business has grown.  He currently wants to take advantage of increased sales during the high season to improve his income a little.  With the loan, he will purchase Ladies' and Men's clothing and undergarments, so he can offer a variety to his customers.  Señor Alexander is grateful for the help that Afodenic, together with Kiva, has offered.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Roger

texts.es: El sr. Roger, sigue con la actividad de agricultor, cuenta que le fue muy bien con el anterior credito, el vende sus productos en el mercado de la localidad directamenmte del productor al consumidor, en esta ocacion solicita el credito para la compra de semillas para siembra de maiz ya que es la epoca de siembra y tiene que aprovechar, y asi genera ma singresos para la siguiente siembra.
texts.en: Roger is still a farmer. He says that the previous loan went very well for him. He sells his product in the market in his community, directly from the producer to the consumer. On this occasion he is asking for the loan to buy seeds to plant corn since it is planting time and he has to take advantage of this time. In this way, he will generate more income for the next crop.

loans.use: to plant corn.

loans.name: Yngrid

texts.es: La socia es Yngrid, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen Asunta de Calca” de la provincia de Calca del Cusco – Perú. Yngrid es una joven muy pro activa, ella trabaja en servicios generales en un hotel, crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas y también ahora se dedica a la panadería en la elaboración  y venta de panes mas ahora para la elaboración de panetones para la campaña navideña. Yngrid esta solicitando su préstamo para comprar insumos como harina, azúcar, levadura, sal, fruta confitada, y pasas para la producción de panetones. para la producción de sus panes, Yngrid está muy agradecida con KIVA por ayudarla con el mantenimiento de su actividad económica la cual representa su principal ingreso económico.
texts.en: This member is Yngrid, who belongs to the "Virgen Asunta de Calca" communal bank of the province of Calca del Cusco, Peru. Yngrid is a very proactive young woman. She works as a cleaner in a hotel, she raises small animals such as guinea pigs and chickens, and now she's also a baker. She makes and sells bread, but right now she's making panettones (sweet bread) for the Christmas season. Yngrid is requesting the loan in order to purchase supplies such as flour, sugar, leavening, salt, candied fruit and raisins for making her panettones and bread. Yngrid is very thankful to Kiva for helping her keep her business going which is her main source of income.

loans.use: to purchase supplies such as flour, sugar, leavening, salt, candied fruit and raisins.

loans.name: Hong

texts.en: Hong is 39 years old. He is married and resides with his two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. He has been involved in breeding pig for more than two years, earning approximately $3 daily. His wife is employed in a garment factory. She makes an income of $3 per day. In order to improve his family’s income, Hong is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase more pigs and fodder for breeding. By doing so, he would generate more income for the family. In the future, he would like to expand his piggery and send his children to a good school. In addition, he wants to build a new concrete house.

loans.use: to purchase more pigs and fodder for breeding

loans.name: Rhodora

texts.en: Rhodora is an industrious mother who helped her husband to find funds for their livelihood. She has been engaged in the hog-raising business for over five years. She is now 40 years old. She wants to raise more hogs, but due to financial difficulties, she can't. So she is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy additional hogs to raise and feed for them. Rhodora hopes to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy additional hogs and feed

loans.name: Anthony Blaine

texts.en: Anthony Blaine, 32, is a business-minded bachelor from Gattaran. He has learned that as of today, most people already feel the hardship of life and he can’t deny that he also experiences that. So he made a way to create higher income from his bakery business. He is asking for financial assistance in the amount of PHP 50,000 to purchase flour, oil, sugar, salt, yeast and to use for maintenance for his machines.  He has always wanted to improve his business in order to offer affordable yet delectable and high quality breads to his villagers. He hopes that his wish for a loan will be provided.

loans.use: to purchase flour, oil, sugar, salt, yeast and use for maintenance for his machines

loans.name: Yon

texts.en:
Yon is 54 years old. She is widowed and resides with five children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She is a Khmer noodle vendor who makes an income of $4 daily. She has been operating the business for over ten years. Four of her children are employed in garment factory. They earn about $15 each day. 

Due to lack of funds, Yon is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase construction materials to finish building her house. This money will help her obtain a comfortable house for her family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her youngest child earn higher education.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to finish building her house

loans.name: Mom

texts.en: Mom is 41 years old. She is married and resides with her three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been selling groceries at home for more than two years, earning approximately $5 daily. Her husband is a driver who makes an income of $7 each day. Two of her children are employed. They earn about $15 per day. In order to improve her family’s finances, Mom is requesting a loan of $1500 to purchase a store in the market to sell groceries. This purchase would enable her to obtain a better place for her business and generate more income to financially support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her youngest child earn a bachelor’s degree. She also wants to build a new house, if possible.

loans.use: to purchase a store in the market to sell groceries

loans.name: Karen

texts.en: Karen is 35 years old and is married to a farmer. They have three children. Karen helps her spouse maintain the farming business that they have operated for almost three years now. From the farming business, they provide sustenance for their family, especially for the education of their children. Karen still wants to pursue their business and not rely only on their remittances, so she is asking for an additional loan of PHP 12,000 to buy vegetable seeds and fertilizers in order to sustain the farming business. In the future, Karen would like to keep producing better crops so she can harvest more and earn profits from the harvest. This will help her achieve financial stability.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds and fertilizers in order to sustain her farming business.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is a responsible housewife who always supports her husband in generating income for the sake of their family. She is engaged in buying and selling fruits and vegetables in the Public Market to generate income. Due to the high cost of commodities and school fees, she aims to improve the business and increase her income to continue supporting the education of their two children. They want them to finish a degree so they will be employed someday. She plans to acquire more fruits and vegetables to sell but she has inadequate capital. Therefore, she is asking for PHP 15,000 to buy more stocks of carrots, potatoes, cabbages, beans, cauliflowers, onions and garlic to sell. She believes that this financial assistance will enable her to improve the business. She hopes that she will be successful and financially stable in the future.

loans.use: to buy more carrots, potatoes, cabbages, beans, cauliflowers, onions and garlic to sell

loans.name: Sorphorn

texts.en: Sorphorn is 36 years old. She is married and resides with her two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been cultivating mushrooms to sell for more than ten years, earning approximately $2 per day. Her husband runs the business of purchasing junk materials to resell. He makes an income of $4 each day. In order to improve her husband’s business, Sorphorn is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase a motorbike to use for transporting junk materials. This purchase will help her husband to transport junk materials in greater quantities and faster. In the future, Sophorn would like to expand her business and send her children to a good school. She also wants to rebuild her present house to make it much better for her family’s living condition.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to use for transporting junk materials.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 34 years old and has two children who attend school. Maricel has a farming business that she has been operating for more than six years now. She plants and harvests corn to sell. She also pays for laborers who help her in the business. Her income of approximately 12,000 PHP per harvest goes for school expenses, meals and revolving capital in the business. 

Maricel would like to keep achieving a healthy harvest to earn more income for her family. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of 30,000 PHP to buy fertilizers and insecticides used in ensuring healthy growth of crops. 

Maricel hopes to keep making the business profitable. This will help provide the best education for her children, which will lead to a progressive life someday.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides use in farming.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is now 56 years old and married but she doesn't have children. Despite this, she helps her husband in generating income to satisfy their necessities and save some for future emergencies. She owns and manages a small bakeshop in the local community while her husband is working in a private company. 

Erlinda plans to earn and save more income in order to help in financing the education of her niece and nephews who are now in tertiary education. In this regard, she plans to bake more recipes in order to satisfy her customers' demand. Due to insufficient capital, she is asking for a loan of P10,000 to buy flour, eggs, milk, yeast and other ingredients needed in the bakeshop. She believes that she will continuously improve the business through this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy flour, eggs, milk, yeast and other ingredients needed in her bake shop

location.town: Brgy. San Fernando, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Marifel

texts.en: Marifel is from the village of Centro 1 in the town of Angadanan. Marifel is 28 years old and married with two children. To earn a living, Marifel is engaged in a sari-sari store. She has been in this business for five years and earns about a minimum of PHP 300 a day. Right now, Marifel is requesting a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy canned goods, noodles, biscuits, assorted bread and condiments to sell. Marifel hopes that she can obtain her requested amount to improve her business and receive a higher income.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, biscuits, assorted breads and condiments to sell

loans.name: Sokrin's Group

texts.en:
Sokrin is aged 41 years and married with six children, one of whom is dependent on her and still in school. She and her husband have worked very hard for 16 years to support their big family by selling grocery items, farming rice and planting lotus in the local area. The current business earns them about 21,000 KHR per day and they manage to save about 10,000 KHR each day after expenses. 

This is the first loan for Sokrin with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group of four to seek a loan. She is going to use her portion to buy more lotus plants to grow. She hopes her lotus will grow healthfully so as to sell it for a good price.

loans.use: To buy more lotus plants to grow

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Angeles

texts.en: Angeles, 54, is grateful for having a family that is very cooperative, loveable and caring. This motivates her to work harder. She is currently operating a sari-sari (variety) store business and seeking additional working capital of PHP 25,000. It will be used to purchase soft drinks, breads, sugar, coffee and detergent soap. These goods will let her earn a higher income. She is hoping that through her hard work, she will have a better life.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, bread, sugar, coffee and detergent soap

loans.name: Khea's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in Kampong Cham province’s Ou Reang Ov district, Khea is a 28 year-old mother of three children, one of whom is still in school. She has been buying and selling fish to support her family and supplements her family’s income by farming rice. Having been in the business for several years, Khea can make daily income from her current business of 26,000KHR and is able to save about 13,000KHR per day after expenses for  future needs.
Khea is in her first microloan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is leading her group of three to ask for a loan of 1,000,000KHR each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fish to resale. She hopes to earn more income from her current business so as to make a living better and keep her child in school.

loans.use: To buy fish to resale.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Samun's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a village of Banteay Meanchey province’s Moungkul Borey district, Samun is aged 57 years and married with three children, four of whom are dependents and still in school. For more than twenty years, Samun and her husband have been growing cassava as the primary source of the family’s income to make a living.  They can earn about 30,000 KHR per day and manage to save about 10,000 KHR each day for the future needs.
Samun’s group consists of two members and this is the first cycle for her loan with VisionFund. She is now leading her group to ask for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, Samun will use her portion to pay for labor costs in harvesting cassava. She hopes to earn more income from her current business so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To pay for labor costs in harvesting cassava.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Despite financial difficulty, Marivic is aspiring to improve their status of living to give her family a better life. To earn a living, she runs a small variety store in their village selling different grocery items. She has been operating the business for almost two years and usually earns a profits of 6,000 PHP a month, which she usually spends for their daily consumption and to finance the school fees of their children.

She aimed to improve the business by increasing her product offerings, but due to inadequate capital, she is asking for an additional of 10,000 PHP to buy additional stock of canned goods, noodles, eggs, snack foods, biscuits, candies, beverages and seasonings for sale. She believes that this financial assistance will enable her to improve the business as she continues to work hard and strive harder.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of canned goods, noodles, eggs, snack foods, biscuits, candies, beverages and seasonings for sale

loans.name: Pom's Group

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house located in Kampong Cham province’s Ou Reang Ov district, Pom is now 39 years old and married. She has six children, three of whom are dependents and still in school. Pom is a fish seller and her husband helps his family to earn additional income by catching fish, which is a business they have engaged in for 19 years. The current business earns them about 19,000KHR per day to support their family’s needs and they can afford to save about 10,000KHR each day. 

Pom was the first cycled client with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is now leading her group of two to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy materials for her husband's fish catching business. She hopes to catch more fish in order to sell them for a price that allows her to increase her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy materials for her husband's fish catching business.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 40 years old, married and has six school-age children. She engages herself in the buying and selling of fruits and vegetables in the local community to supplement her husband's income. She is aiming to improve the business and generate sufficient income to support the education of their children and give them a better life.

Due to insufficient capital, she is requesting additional capital of 15,000 PHP to buy cabbages, sweet potatoes, squashes, taro, onions, sayote tops and garlic for sale. Despite problems and difficulties in life, she believes that she will be going to make an improvement in the business through this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy cabbages, sweet potatoes, squashes, taro, onions, sayote tops and garlic for sale

loans.name: Choub's Group

texts.en:
Choub is aged 39 years old and married. She and her husband have nine children, three of whom are still in school. She and her husband earn a living through farming rice and selling grocery items in a local area to better support her family. They have been in this business for five years. With her current business, Choub is able to earn approximately 23,000 KHR per day to support her family.

Choub’s group is composed of two members who have been with VisionFund for four loan cycles. She completely paid back the past loans which have helped her to better support her business. Now she is leading her group to apply for another loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use a portion of it to buy more grocery items to resell. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her income from her current business so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Phanny's Group

texts.en:
Phanny lives in a rural village of the Mongkul Borey district of Banteay Meanchey province, Cambodia. She is 30 years old and married with two children, both of whom are still in school in the local area. To support the family, Phanny has been working as a rice farmer on a two-hectare farmland for 10 years while her husband is a photographer. The current business earns her family about 18,000 KHR per day to make a living and they can afford to save 8,000 KHR each day after expenses. Low crop yield has been still a challenge for her business.

Phanny has just joined VisionFund this cycle while the other member has been with VisionFund for one cycle already. Now Phanny is leading her group of two to request a loan. Phanny will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to grow her rice healthfully and fruitfully so as to improve her standard of living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en:
A rural villager living in Kampong Cham province’s Ou Reang Ov district, Mom is aged 32 years and married with three children. She has been selling grocery items for several years while her husband complements their income by farming rice. The current business earns her family about 24,000 KHR per day and allows them to save about 12,000 KHR each day after daily expenses.   

Mom is a first-cycle client with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group of three to request a loan. She is going to use her portion to buy more grocery items for selling. She hopes to earn more income from the current business so as to make a living better.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items for selling

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Thoen's Group

texts.en:
Aged 31 years, Thoen is married and lives with her family in a rural area located in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She is a mother of three children, one of whom is dependent and still in school. Thoen and her husband earn a living through farming rice on one-hectares of farmland and planting pineapple, which they have been in for seven years. Together, she and her husband can earn about 20,000 KHR per day from the current business and are able to save about 12,000 KHR each day for the future.

Thoen’s group consists of two members who live in the same village. She is in her first loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is leading her group of two to apply for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her cultivated land. Thoen hopes to get a high yield from her plantation business so as to sell it for a good price to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her cultivated land

loans.name: Sreyneang's Group

texts.en:
A villager from a rural area located in the Tbaung Khum district of Kampong Cham province, Sreyneang is 33 years old and married. She has two children to take care of. The primary sources of her family’s income are from rice farming and cassava planting. To better support the family, her husband sometimes catches fishes for selling. Having been in this business for 14 years, she can earn about 34,000KHR per day and manages to save about 12,000KHR each day after the expenses. 
This is the first loan for Sreyneang’s group of four with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is leading her group to request a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to pay for labor costs to grow her cassava. She hopes this loan will enable her to grow her rice and cassava healthfully.

loans.use: To pay for labor costs to grow her cassava.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Janine

texts.en: Janine is 22 years old and married but has no children yet. Having no other source of income, she runs a small variety store in their community to supplement her husband's income. She aims to improve the business and increase her income to satisfy their needs and save some for future emergencies. She planned to acquire more stocks of grocery items to sell but she has inadequate capital, therefore, Janine is requesting an additional P7,000 to buy canned good, beverages, snack foods, soft drinks, noodles, eggs, candies and seasonings for sale. Through her patience and hard work, she believes that she will make the business grow and improve their standard of living in the future.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages, snack foods, soft drinks, noodles, eggs, candies and seasonings for sale

loans.name: Farah

texts.en:
Ms. Farah is 33 years old and a vigorous, married woman. She has been doing a business of hand-embroidery for the past ten years. She is passionate about her work and client demand is strong. But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. Her husband is employed as a salesperson in a grocery store, but he does not earn enough to support his family well.

Farah's embroidery patterns are very popular on her street and she is the best earning resource in her household. She has two children but lives in a joint family system of fifteen family members with her in-laws.

She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of 25,000 PKR to buy raw materials such as threads, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand. She shared her dream of running a training center for girls of her village. She would teach embroidery skills so they can help her expand her business and to also earn money for themselves. She is also interested in opening her own shop in the market to display her work.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as threads, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand

loans.name: Sinoern

texts.en:
Sinoern, 27, lives in a rural village of Kampong Cham province’s Ou Reang Ov district, Cambodia. She is married and has one son to take care of who is still too young for school. For the last two years, Sinoern has been working as a rice farmer, while her husband is a paid construction worker. Her current business earns her family approximately US$10 per day and she manages to save about US$4 each day after offsetting daily expenses.
 
Sinoern has just joined with VisionFund this cycle. She is seeking a loan of US$1,000. With this loan, she is going to buy a plot of farmland to expand her rice-paddy business. She hopes to get a high yield from her paddy business to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy a plot of farmland to expand her rice-paddy business

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a hardworking mother who raises hogs for selling. She is married to a tricycle operator and is blessed with three children.  

Evelyn is now requesting a loan of P7,000 to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. In providing those necessities and good nutrition, she can produce profitable sales so she can increase her income. She hopes that her business will make a stable income for the benefits of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is 41 years old. She lives with her husband and two children. She has a sari-sari (convenience) store in their village where she sells sugar, oil, coffee and vinegar. She cares for her business because this is a great help in improving their economic living.

She is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy soft drinks, cooking oil and bread as additional commodities to sell. She hopes to gain more profits through these goods in order for her to provide a good living to her family.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, cooking oil and bread

loans.name: Sinat

texts.en:
Sinat lives in a rural village of Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She is 31 years old and married with one daughter, who is in school. To support her family, she has been working as a rice farmer for eight years, while her husband works as a paid taxi driver. The current business earns her about 18,000KHR per day to make a living and she saves 8,000KHR each day after expenses.

Sinat joined with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, this cycle. She is applying for a loan of US$700 to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She will also use a portion of it to buy a proper car for her husband’s taxi business. She hopes to earn more income from the current business so as to better her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland and buy a car for her husband's taxi business

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en: Zenaida is a mother who is blessed with four children. While doing the household chores, she established her source of income in the form of hog fattening. This is her way of helping her husband in uplifting their living. She would like to further develop her business in order to create higher income. Now, she is asking for additional capital of 15,000 PHP to buy feed, vitamins and medicine. She believes that this loan will help her to gain productive income.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and medicine

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 55 years old. She works very hard to provide for her necessities. She operates a grocery store and it has been in operation for five years.

Elizabeth is asking for a loan of 25,000 PHP through ASKI to purchase more groceries such as soft drinks, canned goods, junk food, noodles, breads and spices. The more stock of groceries, the more sales she could earn.

She hopes that through this loan and with her hard work, she can earn more profits for the success of her business as well as for her living costs.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries such as soft drinks, canned goods, junk food, noodles, breads and spices.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Residing in a rural village of the Sampov Meas district of Pursat province, Sok is aged 69 years and married. She has three children. To support her family, she and her husband have been farming rice for 40 years. The current business earns her family about 12,000KHR per day to meet her family’s needs, but she can manage to save about 8,000KHR each day after daily expenses. Drought is the main challenge for her rice-paddy business. 
Sok has been with VisionFund for one cycle. She fully paid back her past loan, which helped her to better support her family's living conditions. Now she is applying for a loan of 2,000,000KHR to buy chickens for raising to earn additional income. She will also use a portion of the loan to buy a plot of farmland. She hopes to earn more income from her current business so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy chickens for raising and to buy a plot of farmland

loans.name: Masaka Group

texts.en: Husna is in her early 20s and married with two small children.  She has been running a beauty salon for four years now.  She works from 8:00 am to 7:00 pm daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit. This will be her first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, and she wants to use it to buy more salon equipment and serve more customers. Her dream is to one day become a millionaire. Husna will share this loan with her loan group "Masaka", which has ten members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loan.

loans.use: to buy more salon equipment and serve more customers.

loans.name: Gantulga

texts.en: Mr. Gantulga is 28 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in a ger (a Mongolian traditional home) on his father-in-law’s plot of land. He has been working as a cook in a restaurant for a long time. Like her husband, his wife also works as a cook in another restaurant, but has now taken her maternity leave. Mr. Gantulga's two elder children both go to elementary school, while his youngest one, who is 1 year old, stays at home with his mother. The family wants to buy some necessary home appliances, so he is requesting a loan of 1,700,000 MNT to purchase a television, oven, and sofa. By doing so, the family can live in a comfortable place and work enthusiastically.

loans.use: to buy a television, oven, and sofa for his home

loans.name: Regie

texts.en:
Regie is a very hard worker and very dedicated to his source of income. This business was a great help in providing for the needs of his family, so he is being patient and a hard worker. Every day he makes great effort to catch fishes in the river. And to catch plenty of fishes, he is asking for a loan 12,000 pesos to buy a fish net and little boat. 

He is very optimistic he can gain a higher income this time.

loans.use: to buy a fish net and little boat.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is 47 years old, and a married woman. She has had a sewing business for the past four years. She knows the techniques of sewing very well and over time she has become well known in her community. Her designs are very popular on her street, and she is the best source of income in her household. However, she initially faced a lot of problems, especially in meeting her daily expenses and also in the growth of her children. She is a mother of six; three of her daughters help her in her business. 

Razia wants to grow her business so she has requested a loan of PKR 20,000 to buy a new sewing machine with spools of threads in various colors. She has been in association with Kashf Foundation for four years. She has a dream of running a training center for girls in her area. She would like to teach them sewing skills, so they can help her expand her business, and to also earn money for themselves.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine with spools of threads in various colors.

loans.name: Majlinda

texts.en:
Majlinda, who lives in northern Albania with her immediate family, is 45 years old and has five children, from age 12 to 18. They all go to school. She has been working in a bakery for almost 22 years. Some 13 years ago, she started operating an animal husbandry activity, which has become an additional income source for her family of seven. 

Majlinda works very hard to maintain both her animal husbandry business and her bakery job; she gets some help from her husband, who takes the milk to the local market of a little town.

She needs to repair a damaged stable, and this is the reason why she is requesting a second loan. The previous one has been repaid.

loans.use: To repair a damaged stable

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: La socia es la señora Martha, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen Asunta de Calca” de la provincia de Calca del Cusco – Perú La señora Martha es docente de educación secundaria y paralelamente se dedica a la comercialización de artesanía, principalmente de artículos  cerámicos y tejidos, los cuales comercializa en el mercado artesanal del distrito de Pisac, que es uno de los principales y más importantes del país. Martha está solicitando su préstamo para comprar mercadería como chompas, bufandas, ponchos, guantes y adornos cerámicos para capitalizar su actividad, Martha está muy agradecida con KIVA por ayudarla con el mantenimiento de su actividad económica la cual representa el principal ingreso económico y  sustento de su familia.
texts.en: Martha belongs to communal bank 'Virgen Asunta de Calca', from Calca province in Cusco, Peru. She is a secondary school teacher who also sells crafts, mainly ceramics and woven cloth, at the artesans' fair of Pisac district, one of the main and most important such fairs in the country. She asks for this loan in order to buy crafts to sell, such as jumpers, scarves, ponchos, gloves, and ceramics, so as to increase the income she derives from her business. Martha is very grateful to Kiva lenders for their help with her business, which is her family's main source of income.

loans.use: to buy crafts to sell.

loans.name: Bibirani

texts.en: Bibirani is a 39-year-old married woman. The man shown in the photo is her husband; Bibirani appears in a veil due to her traditional limitations. She has been growing vegetables with her husband in their back yard for 22 years. Every morning they pluck fresh vegetables and take them to a small shop where they sell them along with some fruit that they purchase from a wholesaler. Recent years have been challenging for the couple as their produce is decreasing at a fast rate and their shop is not making enough sales to support their family of 6 members. Bibirani is a mother of four children, three of whom go to school; but the high cost of education is over-burdening their finances. She has requested a loan of PKR 20,000 from Kashf and wishes to purchase fertilizers and high quality seeds in anticipation of a better yield. Speaking to a loan officer, she said that her eldest son has recently joined them in business and will help improve productivity.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and high quality seeds in anticipation of a better yield.

loans.name: Safia

texts.en: Safia is a 46-year-old married woman and a mother of six. The man shown in the photo is her husband. For sixteen years the couple have been successfully running a small general store in their community. They offer various goods for daily use at reasonable prices. She has good communication skills and has retained many customers. In order to grow her business, Safia has requested a loan of PKR 50,000 to purchase more rice, flour and grains. She will then consistently be able to meet the increasing demand of their customers. She has been in association with Kashf for seven years and has shown excellent repayment behavior.   She wishes to utilize part of the  revenue to deal with personal expenses and to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, flour and grains.

loans.name: Liljana

texts.en:
Liljana, this thirty-year-old lady, has been recently married to her husband, who was born legally blind. “After years of dating, despite disapproval from my family, I decided to marry Besnik and I am happy I did,” Liljana said. “I feel blessed providing for him financially and looking after him as well,” she continued saying.

She works with the local government offices in a northern city where they both reside. They are planning to have children soon and they can’t hide their excitement even talking about it.
 
The loan of 50,000 Albanian lek they are requesting is to purchase electrical appliances for their apartment.

loans.use: to purchase electrical appliances

loans.name: Maria Jesus

texts.es: La socia es la señora María Jesus, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen Asunta de Calca” de la provincia de Calca del Cusco – Perú La señora María Jesus es docente de educación primaria y paralelamente continua dedicandose a la comercialización de productos de belleza en general, los cuales vende de forma directa y a solicitud de sus clientes. María Jesus está solicitando el  préstamo para comprar cosméticos, maquillaje y perfumería en general para capitalizar su actividad económica complementaria ahora que estan en plena compaña navideña, María Jesus está muy agradecida con KIVA por ayudarla con el mantenimiento de su actividad económica la cual representan el sustento de su casa y su familia.
texts.en: María Jesús belongs to communal bank 'Virgen Asunta de Calca', from Calca province in Cusco, Peru. She is a primary school teacher who also sells cosmetics, both in direct sales and on request. She asks for this loan in order to buy cosmetics, make-up, and perfumes in order to take full advantage, commercially speaking, of the Christmas season. She is very grateful to Kiva lenders for their help with her business, which helps support her family and pay for household expenses.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.es: La socia es la señora Valentina, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen Asunta de Calca” de la provincia de Calca del Cusco – Perú. La señora Valentina continúa dedicandose a la preparación y venta de alimentos, los cuales comercializa en un puesto del mercado principal de su comunidad. Valentina tiene una hija que está estudiando medicina en la república de Bolivia y para pagar su educación es que la socia trabaja y se sacrifica; por ello Valentina está solicitando el préstamo para pagar los estudios de su hija, Valentina está muy agradecida con KIVA por ayudarla con la educación de su hija.
texts.en: This member is Valentina, who belongs to the "Virgen Asunta de Calca" communal bank of the province of Calca del Cusco, Peru. Valentina still prepares and sells food in a stall located in the main market of her community. Valentina has a daughter who's studying medicine in Bolivia, and she works hard and makes sacrifices in order to pay for her education. That's why Valentina is requesting a loan so that she can pay for her daughter's studies. Valentina is very thankful to Kiva for helping her with her daughter's education.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's higher education costs.

loans.name: Sorayda

texts.es: La socia es la señora Sorayda, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen Asunta de Calca” de la provincia de Calca del Cusco – Perú La señora Sorayda tiene una tienda de productos de agro veterinaria en la cual continúa expendiendo productos como medicinas, vacunas,fertilizantes, abonos, semillas y otros productos agropecuarios. Sorayda está solicitando su préstamo para comprar mercadería antes mencionada para capitalizar su comercio, Sorayda está muy agradecida con KIVA por ayudarla con el mantenimiento de su actividad económica la cual representa el principal ingreso económico y  sustento de su familia.
texts.en:
The member, Sorayda, belongs to the group “Virgen Asunta de Calca” in the province of Calca del Cusco, Perú. Sorayda has a veterinary supply store, in which she continues expanding her products to medicines, vaccines, fertilizers, manure, seeds and other agricultural products.

Sorayda is requesting this loan to buy the above mentioned products to capitalize on their trade. Sorayda is very grateful to Kiva for helping support her economic activity, which is the main income and livelihood of her family.

loans.use: to buy medicine, vaccines, fertilizers, manure and seeds.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: La socia es la señora Martha, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen Asunta de Calca” de la provincia de Calca del Cusco – Perú La señora Martha continúa dedicandose a la agricultura, principalmente al cultivo de maíz, papas y pastos, y también a la crianza de animales menores como gallinas y cuyes. Martha está solicitando el préstamo para comprar 5 sacos de abono y fertilizante para la proxima siembra, Martha está muy agradecida con KIVA por ayudarla con el mantenimiento de su actividad económica la cual representan el sustento de su casa y su familia.
texts.en:
Martha is a member of the group “Virgen Asunta de Calca” in the province of Calca del Cusco, Perú. Martha continues to devote herself to agriculture, mainly through the cultivation of corn, potatoes and grasses, and also a small part by raising chickens and guinea pigs.

Martha is requesting a loan to buy 5 bags of compost and fertilizer for the next planting season. Martha is very grateful to Kiva for supporting her economic activity which represents the livelihood of her home and family.

loans.use: to buy 5 bags of compost and fertilizer.

loans.name: Mirian Gladis

texts.es: La socia es la señora Mirian, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen Asunta de Calca” de la provincia de Calca del Cusco – Perú La señora Mirian continua dedicándose a la atención de su cafetín en una institución educativa de su comunidad, y ahora también y aprovechando la asistencia de mucha juventud, también está incursionando en el entretenimiento realizando tómbolas y alquilando juegos de feria como futbol de mesa y tiro al blanco entre otros juegos de feria. Mirian está solicitando el préstamo para comprar peluches y juguetes para entregarlos como premios de juegos, Mirian está muy agradecida con KIVA por ayudarla con el crecimiento de su nueva actividad económica la cual representa el crecimiento de su actividad y el sustento de su casa y su familia.
texts.en:
Mirian is a member of the group “Virgen Asunta de Calca” in the province of Calca del Cusco, Perú. Mirian continues to dedicate all of her attention to her coffee shop in an educational institution in her community. Now she is making use of the presence of many youth, and is beginning to offer entertainment, such as raffles and renting games, like a Foosball table and darts.

Mirian is requesting a loan to buy stuffed animals and toys to give as prizes for games. Mirian is very grateful to Kiva for the growth in her new economic activity which represents growth in the livelihood of her home and family.

loans.use: to buy stuffed animals and toys.

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “NUEVA ESPERANZA”  iniciará el noveno ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por doce integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Adriana es la secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tienda de abarrotes, venta de chicharrones, repostería, taller de confección, venta  de jugo, venta de verduras, venta de aceite, tejido de busos y awayos, carnicería,  venta de abarrotes, tejido de mantas, venta de comida.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Adriana es integrante, ella indica que es el quinto año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio costura de venta de chicharrones; cuenta que este negocio lo emprendió por iniciativa propia, ya que este negocio le genera mucha rentabilidad.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de carne  de cerdo y mote) que adquirirá de las tiendas de venta por mayor y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones del área de salud y crédito.

En la fotografía acompaña al grupo Silvia de gorra celeste, que es la hija de la señora Rosario
texts.en:
The group “NUEVA ESPERANZA” (New Hope) will begin their ninth cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Focal de Panamericana. The group is composed of 12 members and is directed by a board of directors where Adriana is the secretary. Members of the group are involved in the following businesses: two grocery stores, selling pork, pastries, tailoring, selling juice, selling vegetables, selling oil, woven bags and awayos, a butcher shop, woven blankets, food sales.

The loan will benefit small micro-enterprises where Adriana has an integral part. She indicated that it is the fifth year that integrates Pro Mujer, entering at the invitation of a friend that is a member of the institution. She currently has a business selling pork cracklings. She began this business on her own, and it is very profitable.

The loan will increase capital (to buy pork and mote) which will be acquired wholesale in store and sold at a higher profit. This will allow her to generate more resources to maintain her home. She is married and has two children.

When she was asked what she liked about Pro Mujer, she responded that she liked the training in the areas of health and credit.

In the accompanied photograph of the group, Silvia is in the cap, she is the daughter of Rosario.

loans.use: to buy pork and mote

loans.name: Herminia

texts.es:
Doña Herminia es una señora muy emprendedora, está muy feliz de poder obtener un crédito por medio de las empresas de apoyo comunal, pues quiere reparar su vivienda aprovechando la época de verano en la que estamos, necesita reparar el techo, el piso, las paredes y pintar, ya que todas estas áreas se encuentran deterioradas, ella está solicitando un crédito por la suma de quinientos cincuenta mil colones exactos
(¢550.000), agradece la oportunidad que se brinda a las personas de bajos recursos.
texts.en:
Herminia is a very enterprising woman. She is very happy to be able to get a loan through companies of communal support, because she wants to repair her home while taking advantage of the summer season.

She needs to repair the roof, the floor, the walls, and to paint, since all of these areas are damaged. She is requesting a loan for 550,000 colones ($1100) exactly. She appreciated the opportunity that is offered to people with low income.

loans.use: to buy material for improved housing.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
La socia Isabel pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de los Milagros de Chimpahuaylla” de la ciudad del Cusco-Perú. 

La socia Isabel continua dedicandose a la ganaderia y a su negocio de picanteria,la socia vende comidas tipicas y diferentes bebidas como cerveza,gaseosas entre otros,la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el credito para la compra de cerveza para su picanteria.

La socia está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Isabel belongs to the Communal Bank "Señor de los Milagros de Chimpahuaylla" in the city of Cusco, Perú. 

Isabel continues to make a living raising cattle and attending to her restaurant. She sells typical meals and drinks including beer and soda, among other drinks. She is doing well with her business thanks to the perseverance that she puts into her business everyday. She is a responsible and driven person who is able to help her family get ahead. 

This member is requesting a loan to buy beer for her restaurant. She is very grateful for Kiva for allowing her to give a greater quality of life to her family. She is committed to making the loan installments agreed upon.

loans.use: to buy beer for her restaurant.

loans.name: Delia

texts.es: La socia es la señora Delia, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen Asunta de Calca” de la provincia de Calca del Cusco – Perú. La señora Delia continúa dedicandose a la panadería en la producción y venta de este alimento. Delia está solicitando su  préstamo como en anteriores ocasiones, para comprar insumos como harina, azúcar, levadura, sal, etc. para la producción de panetones para esta campaña navideña, Delia está muy agradecida con KIVA por ayudarla con el mantenimiento de su actividad económica la cual representa el principal ingreso económico y  sustento de su familia.
texts.en: Our partner is Delia, she belongs to the community bank "Virgen Asunta de Calca" in the province of Calca del Cusco, Peru.  Delia is still working in her business of baking and selling bread.  Delia is requesting the loan to buy supplies like flour, sugar, yeast, salt, etc., to make bread for this Christmas season, Delia is grateful to Kiva for helping her with her business activity which represents the main income source for her and the support of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as flour, sugar, yeast, salt, etc.

loans.name: María Isabel

texts.es: María Isabel es un ejemplo de una persona de trabajo y de decisión, pues se ha propuesto metas que ha cumplido, acondicionó un sector de su vivienda para que funcione como tienda , quiere proveer su negocio con artículos de bisutería, cosmetología, prendas de vestir y otros, su solicitud de crédito es por un millón de colones (¢1.000.000)  con lo que surtirá su tienda y por supuesto aumentará sus ingresos aprovechando la época navideña que es excelente para el comercio.
texts.en: María Isabel is an example of a hard working person who knows how to make the right decisions. She has proposed goals that she has now fulfilled. She renovated a part of her home to serve as a store and wants to offer jewelry, cosmetics, apparel and other items in her store. Her loan request is for one million colones (¢1,000,000) with which she will stock her store and increase her earnings by taking advantage of the Christmas season which is great for retail.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Noemi

texts.es: La socia es la señora Noemí, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen Asunta de Calca” de la provincia de Calca del Cusco – Perú La señora Noemí tiene un bazar donde continúa dedicandose al comercio de productos varios como productos de higiene personal y también pasamanería. Noemí está solicitando el préstamo para comprar mercadería como perfumería, productos de aseo como jabón, shampoo y también productos de pasamanería para capitalizar su comercio, Noemí está muy agradecida con KIVA por ayudarla con el mantenimiento de su actividad económica la cual representa el principal ingreso económico y  sustento de su familia.
texts.en: Noemí’s a member of the “Virgen Asunta de Calca” communal bank in Calca del Cusco Province, Peru.  She has a bazaar where she continues working selling various products like personal hygiene items and notions.  She’s asking for the loan to buy merchandise like perfumery, cleaning supplies like soap and shampoo and also notions to stock her business.  Noemí is very grateful to KIVA for helping her maintain her economic activity that’s her main source of income for family support.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, cleaning supplies and notions.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es: La socia es la señora Luz Marina, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen Asunta de Calca” de la provincia de Calca del Cusco – Perú La señora Luz Marina es docente de educación primaria y paralelamente continú a dedicandose a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas. Luz Marina está solicitando el préstamo para comprar alimento como pastos, comprimidos y maíz para sus animales, Luz Marina está muy agradecida con KIVA por ayudarla con el mantenimiento de su actividad económica la cual representa el principal ingreso económico y  sustento de su familia.
texts.en: Luz Marina's a member of the “Virgen Asunta de Calca” communal bank in Calca del Cusco Province, Peru.  She’s an elementary school teacher but also continues raising small animals like guinea pigs and chickens.  Luz Marina is asking for a loan to buy animal feed like grasses, concentrated feed and corn for her animals.  Luz Marina is very grateful to KIVA for helping her stay in business which is her main source of income for family support.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: María Rocio

texts.es: María Rocío de 57 años de edad ha tenido que enfrentar situaciones críticas en la vida, perder a su esposo ha sido el suceso que más dolor le ha causado. Viuda y con 6 hijos a cargo, tomó la decisión de buscar una fuente de empleo que le permitiera sacar adelante su familia. “Gracias a Dios aprendí de confección y decidí dedicarme a este oficio” con estas palabras María nos cuenta como inició su negocio. Comenzó realizando costuras a sus vecinos hasta que logró reunir un capital y comprar una máquina con la cual comenzó a confeccionar. Posteriormente montó su propio taller en el que uno de sus hijos le colabora. En la actualidad sueña con expandir su negocio y crear una marca propia, por lo cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito para la compra de insumos y equipos que le permitan ampliar su capacidad de producción y mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
María Rocío, 57, has had to face critical life situations; losing her husband was the most painful of all.  A widow with six children in her care, she decided to find a source of employment that would make it possible for her to move her family forward.  “Thanks to God I had learned to sew and I decided to go into this occupation.”  With these words, María relates how she started her business.  

She started out doing sewing for neighbors until she saved up enough capital to buy a sewing machine to start making clothes.  She later set up her own workshop where one of her children helps her.  She currently dreams with expanding the business and create her own line of clothing for which she’s requesting a loan to buy supplies and equipment to expand production capacity and improve her income.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, fabric and thread.

loans.name: Jack Harrison

texts.es: El socio es el señor Jack, él pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen Asunta de Calca” de la provincia de Calca del Cusco – Perú. Jack tiene una librería donde continúa vendiendo artículos de como libros, articulos de oficina y papelería en general. Jack está solicitando el préstamo para comprar mercadería como cuadernos, libros, laminas didácticas educativas y útiles  de escritorio y la oficina en general, por ello el socio está muy agradecido con KIVA por ayudarlo a continuar trabajando en su actividad comercial la cual representa el sustento de su casa y de su familia.
texts.en: Jack belongs to the “Virgen Asunta de Calca” communal bank in the Calca del Cusco Province, Peru.  Jack owns a bookstore where he continues selling such items as books, office supplies and stationery supplies in general.  Jack’s asking for a loan to buy merchandise like notebooks, books, didactic laminated sheets and office supplies in general.  He’s very grateful to KIVA for helping him continue to work in his commercial activity which represents his being able to support his home and family.

loans.use: to buy school and office supplies.

loans.name: Rafael Ángel

texts.es: Rafael desde su juventud se convirtió en un hombre de negocios. A laborado como independiente en una cafetería la cual es el sustento para su familia compuesta por su esposa y dos hijos. Con el esfuerzo y dedicación ha logrado sacar adelante su negocio, el cual goza de un buen nombre en el sector. Asegura que su mayor reto es poder ampliar su local y la oferta de productos, debido a que sueña en ser un empresario de éxito. Su familia es su razón de ser y el motor que lo impulsa a laborar 12 horas diarias. Se encuentra solicitando un crédito con el que espera poder comprar surtido para incrementar sus ventas en fin de año.
texts.en: Rafael became a businessman when still a youth.  He has worked independently in his café which is the source of support for his family composed of his wife and two children.  With his effort and dedication he’s managed to move the business forward and it now enjoys a good local reputation.  He assures that his greatest challenge is to be able to expand the locale and the variety of goods on offer because he dreams with becoming a successful businessman.  His family is his reason for living and what pushes him to work 12 hours daily.  He’s asking for a loan to buy stock merchandise to increase end-of-year sales.

loans.use: to buy liquor and pastries.

loans.name: Lizardo

texts.es: El socio es el señor Lizardo, él pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen Asunta de Calca” de la provincia de Calca del Cusco – Perú. Lizardo tiene 37 años de edad, tiene una relación de unión libre y de esa unión tiene 2 hijos. Lizardo es docente de educación primaria y enseña en una escuela de su comunidad y paralelamente posee una moto carga, la cual alquila prestando servicio de transporte de carga para mercadería y desmonte, Él socio está solicitando el préstamo para realizar mantenimiento a su moto carga, por ello el socio está muy agradecido con KIVA por ayudarlo a continuar trabajando en su actividad complementaria,  la cual representa el sustento de su casa y de su familia.
texts.en: This member is Lizardo. He belongs to the community bank “Virgin Asunta de Calca” in the province of Calca del Cusco, Peru. Lizardo is 37 years old. He has a common law relationship, from which he has two children. Lizardo is a primary school teacher and he teaches in a school in his community. Parallel, he also owns a cargo motorcycle, which he hires out, to offer a transport service for merchandise and removals. The member is applying for this loan in order to service this motorcycle. Lizard is very grateful to KIVA for helping him to continue working in this, his complementary business activity, as it represents for him the livelihood of his home and his family.

loans.use: to service his cargo transport vehicle.

loans.name: Santos Javier

texts.es: El Sr. Santos tiene 32 años y es casado con 2 hijos que son de las edades de  4 y 8 años, el se dedica a la venta de ganado, el vende en las distintas ferias de la ciudad de la ciudad de El Alto, el vive en la localidad de Batallas  y tiene  a su ganado en la cumbre en un terreno que él tiene, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, El Sr. Santos va a usar este préstamo para la compra de ganado y después llevar a las distintas ferias, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es falta de capital, El Sr. Santos enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la poca demanda en ocasiones ya sea por problemas de clima o de transporte, desea con el tiempo poder comprar un camión de mayor capacidad para poder transportar mayor cantidad de ganado.
texts.en:
Santos is 32 years old and is married with two children, aged 4 and 8. He sells livestock in various markets in the city of El Alto, Bolivia.  He lives in the area of Batallas and has his livestock graze on a mountain peak where he has some land.

This is his first loan from this institution, and he will use the funds to purchase livestock so he can then bring them to various markets to sell.  He is seeking the loan because he lacks working capital.  He faces challenges in his business such as decreased demand from time to time, whether it be due to problems with the weather or transportation.  Eventually he wishes to buy a truck so that he can transport a larger number of animals.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Flor Elena

texts.es:
Flor Elena  vive en la zona norte del país y en su comunidad se destaca por su molino de maíz que todos los lugareños aprovechan para procesar este grano y producir alimentos a base de este producto, ella también elabora y vende sus propios platillos en el comercio local, solicita un préstamo por  un millón de colones
(¢1.000.000) para comprar una selladora de molino y así vender empacado y sellado sus productos, y de esta forma mejorar la calidad en el servicio al cliente.
texts.en: Flor Elena lives in the north of Costa Rica. In her community, many of the residents are involved in processing corn and producing corn-based products. Flor Elena also makes and sells her own dishes in her local market. She is seeking a loan of one million colones in order to buy a sealer for her corn mill. This will allow her to sell packed and sealed products, which will enable her to provide enhanced service to her customers.

loans.use: to purchase a sealer for her corn mill.

loans.name: Abass

texts.en: This is 52-year-old Abass. He is married and has five children ages 23, 12, 19, 17 and 15. He has two additional dependents who live with him for schooling.  In 1997, Abass established his provisions and other confectioneries business. He began his business just for self-empowerment. His business is located at the center of town and his main customers are all classes of business people. Working 7 days a week and 14 hours a day, he earns about Le 400,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan of Le 5,000,000. Abass has already received and successfully repaid two loans and now requires a new loan in order to buy sugar, sardines and batteries. He hopes that this loan will help him with more stock for his business. In the future, Abass plans to educate his children, to erect a house and to own a private car. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy sardines, batteries and sugar

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.es: La socia es la señora Jesusa, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen Asunta de Calca” de la provincia de Calca del Cusco – Perú La señora Jesusa tiene 50 años de edad, está casada y tiene 2 hijos, la socia es docente de educación primaria y paralelamente se dedica a la a la crianza de animales menores, los cuales comercializa en los principales mercados de su comunidad. Jesusa está solicitando su  préstamo para comprar cuyes, pollos y gallinas para capitalizar su actividad económica complementaria, Jesusa está muy agradecida con KIVA por ayudarla con el mantenimiento de su actividad económica complementaria, la cual representan el sustento de su casa y su familia.
texts.en:
Jesusa is a member of the community bank “Virgen Asunta de Calca” in the province of Cusco in Peru.  She is 50 years old and is married with two children.  She is an elementary school teacher and also raises small animals, which she sells in the main markets of her community.  

She is seeking this loan in order to buy Guinea pigs, chickens and hens for her side business.  She is very grateful to Kiva for helping her to maintain this business, which helps her to support her household and her family.

loans.use: to buy Guinea pigs, chickens and hens.

loans.name: Roger

texts.es: El socio es el señor Roger, él pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen Asunta de Calca” de la provincia de Calca del Cusco – Perú. Roger tiene 30 años de edad, tiene una relación de unión libre y de esa unión tiene 1 hijo de 3 años. Roger es técnico en informática y paralelamente tiene una librería donde vende artículos de oficina, libros y papelería en general,  Él socio está solicitando el préstamo para comprar mercadería como cuadernos, libros, laminas didácticas educativas y útiles  de escritorio en general, por ello el socio está muy agradecido con KIVA por ayudarlo a mantenerse trabajando en su actividad complementaria,  la cual representa el sustento de su casa y de su familia.
texts.en:
The borrower is Roger, and he belongs to the “Virgen Asunta de Calca” communal bank in the Calca province of Cusco, Peru. Roger is 30 years old, is in a common-law relationship, and has a three-year-old son. 

Roger is a computer technician, and along with this has a bookstore where he sells office supplies, books and stationery in general. 

He is requesting the loan to buy merchandise such as notebooks, books, educational wall charts, and office supplies in general. For this, he is very grateful to Kiva for helping him to continue working in his additional business, which enables him to support his household and family.

loans.use: To buy notebooks, books, educational wall charts, and office supplies in general.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
Sandra vive en la zona norte del país con su hijo de tres años de edad, trabaja vendiendo productos de catálogo en diferentes localidades , ella quiere abarcar más lugares para aumentar su clientela y  por supuesto sus ingresos, por esta razón quiere comprar una motocicleta  para trasladarse a varias zonas  y ofrecer sus productos y sobre todo aprovechar la época navideña que es la temporada más alta en cuanto a ventas.
Sandra está solicitando un millón treinta y cinco mil colones (¢1.035.000) para comprar su motocicleta y lograr sus metas.
texts.en: Sandra lives in the northern part of Costa Rica with her three-year-old son. She works selling products from catalogs in various locations. She wants to expand into other areas in order to grow her client base and of course her income. For this purpose she wants to buy a motorcycle so that she can travel to various locations and offer her products. Above all she wants to take advantage of the Christmas season, in which there is a temporary increase in sales. She is seeking one million and thirty-five colones in order to buy a motorcycle to help her reach her goals.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es:
Carolina vive con su familia al norte del país, y con el objetivo de colaborar con los gastos del hogar , decidió desde hace un año vender ropa a domicilio, actividad que ha sido muy acogida por las comunidades vecinas , la demanda de este producto aumentó en esta época y ella necesita comprar  mercadería para cumplir con los pedidos de  sus clientes, por lo que solicita un crédito de un millón cuarenta mil colones 
(¢1.040.000), con lo que espera salir adelante.
texts.en: Carolina lives with her family in the north of Costa Rica. In order to help support her family, she decided one year ago to sell clothing out of her home. This activity has been very well-received in her community. The demand for her products has increased during this season, and she needs to buy merchandise in order to fulfill her customers' orders. For this reason, she is seeking a loan of one million and forty colones, which she hopes will help her to reach her goals.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Gibrilla

texts.en: This is 32-year-old Gibrilla.  He is married and has two children who are eight and five years old. In 2001, Gibrilla established his clothing and traveling box business. He began his business because he wanted to engage himself in economic activities to avoid being idle. His business is located in the heart of town and his main customers are both men and women but mostly women. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about Le 620,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan of Le 4,500,000. Gibrilla has already received and successfully repaid two loans and now requires a new loan to buy jeans trousers ,  a traveling box  and Polo shirts. He hopes that this loan will empower him to solve his domestic problems. In the future, Gibrilla plans to establish a boutique, to complete the construction of his house and to educate his kids. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy jeans trousers, a travelling box and polo shirts

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es: Ana Cecilia de 38 años, es madre soltera de tres hijos menores de edad. Esta mujer es responsable de sus hijos y su madre debido a que su padre falleció y su esposo la abandonó. Tras haberse quedado sin empleo se vio en la necesidad de generar ingresos para solventar las carencias económicas por las que se encontraba. Decidió montar una tienda en su casa, la cual se encuentra con muy poco surtido porque no cuenta con los recursos para invertir en ella. Como si esto fuera poco, sanidad le exigió que debe cambiar el lavaplatos y el baño de su residencia, por lo cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito para realizar los ajustes que le solicitaron, de lo contrario le cerrarán su negocio. Ana se encuentra muy preocupada porque su tienda es la única entrada económica que ella tiene, sus hijos se encuentran en la escuela y su madre requiere de medicamentos que ella tiene que suministrarle. Por estas razones ella no puede quedarse sin ingresos.
texts.en: Ana Cecilia, 38, is a single mother of three minor children.  This woman is responsible for her children and her mother because her father died and her husband abandoned her.  When she became unemployed she needed to earn income to solve the economic need she was facing.  She decided to open a home-based grocery store that had very little stock merchandise because of the little capital she had available to invest in it.
