And as if this weren’t enough, the health department is requiring her to replace her kitchen sink and the bathroom at home which is why she’s asking for a loan to do the adjustments they require because if she does not do them they will shut her business down.  Ana is very worried because her store is her only source of income and her children are in school and her mother needs medicine that she must provide and for all these reasons she cannot be left without income.

loans.use: to replace the kitchen sink and remodel the restroom in her business.

loans.name: Yadira Yamileth

texts.es:
La señora Yadira es una persona responsable honesta y trabajadora, vive junto a su esposo y sus hijos en una comunidad de Choluteca, al sur de Honduras.
Doña Yadira su negocio es la venta de tortillas. El préstamo lo necesita para la compra de maíz, cal y leña, etc. Con el préstamo ella  espera que las ventas aumenten al tener siempre el producto que sus clientes le piden a diario y poder satisfacer la necesidad de los mismos y gracias a esto tener un poco mas de ingresos que aportar a la familia y mejorar el estilo de vida de los mismos.
Doña Yadira en el futuro ella espera que su negocio crezca y sea el más conocido de la zona  y que su familia pueda vivir de una mejor manera y así mismo que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y se conviertan en personas de bien y con mejores oportunidades.


Choluteca,  Honduras – Noviembre del 2012
texts.en:
Yadira is a respectable, honest, and hardworking woman.  She lives with her husband and children in the Choluteca community of southern Honduras.

Yadira sells tortillas and needs this loan to buy dried corn, salt, firewood, etc.  With the help of this loan, she expects that her sales will increase because she will have more products to offer her customers who request them daily.  Thanks to this she will have a bit more income with which to support her family and improve her own lifestyle.

Yadira wants to grow her business in the future, for it to become the most well-known in the zone, and that her family will be able to live in a better manner.  She also wants her children to finish their schooling and become persons of means with better opportunities.

loans.use: to buy supplies and ingredients.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: La Sra.  Norma tiene 41 años, tiene un hijo de la edad de 12 años, ella se dedica a la venta de variedad de ropa de temporada y en esta ocasión ella vende variedad de chamarras, ella tiene un puesto fijo en uno de los mercados más concurridos de la zona de el Tejar donde ofrece sus productos,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, La Sra.  Norma va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de variedad de  chamarras  por mayor y de esta manera brindar variedad de ropa  a su clientela e incrementar sus ganancias,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio y también que se acerca la época de de fin de año y esta época es de mucha demanda, La Sra.  Norma va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando variedad de ropa, La Sra.  Norma es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en: Norma is 41 years old and has a 12 year old son.  She sells a variety of seasonal clothing and at this time sells jackets.  She has a point of sale in one of the best shopped at markets in the zone.  This loan is her first within the institution and she will use the money to buy a variety of jackets in quantity.  In this way she will have a selection of clothing for her customers and be able to increase her profits.  Her reason for asking for this loan is to continue improving her business and because the end of year season is beginning and there is a lot of customer demand.  Norma will also use the benefits to continue buying clothing.  She is a hardworking lady and id happy about the opportunity.

loans.use: to buy jackets.

loans.name: Belkis

texts.es:
La joven Belkis es una persona honesta responsable y trabajadora vive junto a su esposo y sus 4 hijos al sur de Honduras.  Su negocio es la venta de pescado seco. 
Belkis el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de pescado wicho, curvina y babosa. Con el préstamo ella espera que las ventas aumenten al tener más productos que ofrecer  a los clientes que a diario la visitan y poder satisfacer la necesidad de los mismos.
Belkis espera poder mejorar un poco la calidad de vida  de su la familia, gracias a los ingresos que obtenga de sus ventas. En unos años ella espera que su negocio crezca y sea el más conocido de la comunidad y con esto poder seguir apoyando a sus hijos para que sean unos profesionales  y tengan mejores oportunidades en la vida.


Choluteca, Honduras –  Noviembre del 2012
texts.en:
Belkis is an honest and responsible, hardworking woman who lives with her husband and four children in southern Honduras.  She sells dried fish.

Belkis needs this loan to buy wicho, curvina, and babosa fish.  She hopes that her sales will increase because she will have more products to offer her customers who visit her daily, and that she will better be able to satisfy their needs. 

Belkis hopes to improve her family’s quality of life a bit, thanks to the income she will get from her sales.  She hopes that her business will grow in the next few years, and become the best known in the neighborhood and with this be able to support her children so that they will become professionals and have more opportunities in life.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El joven Juan es una persona honesta responsable y muy trabajadora, vive junto a sus padres y hermanos al sur de Honduras. 
Juan su negocio es una pulpería. El préstamo lo necesita para la compra de arroz, manteca, frijoles, pan, azúcar, churros, refrescos, huevos, queso,  mantequilla, agua, galletas, salsas, pastas, condimentos, etc. Con el préstamo espera que las ventas aumenten en su negocio y tener más producto que ofrecer a los clientes que lo visitan y con esto poder recibir un poco mas de ingresos para mejorar el estilo de vida de su familia.
Juan en unos años espera que su negocio crezca hasta convertirse en un mini mercadito con amplia variedad de productos y así apoyar a sus padres y hermanos para que vivan de una mejor manera y que sus hermanos terminen sus estudios para que se conviertan en personas de bien y con mejores oportunidades.



Choluteca, Honduras – Noviembre del 2012
texts.en:
Juan is an honest, responsible, and hardworking young man who lives with his parents and siblings in southern Honduras.

He has a grocery store and he will use the money from this loan to buy rice, lard, beans, bread, sugar, churros, soft drinks, eggs, cheese, butter, water, cookies, salsas, pasta, condiments, etc.  He expects his sales to increase and to have more products on hand to offer the customers who visit him.  In this way he can make a little more profit with which to improve his family’s quality of life.

In a few years he expects his business to begin growing until it becomes a mini market with a large variety of products.  In this way he will be able to support his parents and siblings, so that they will live under better conditions and so that his siblings will finish their schooling and can convert themselves into persons of means with better opportunities.

loans.use: to stock his store.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La señora Juana es una persona trabajadora, honesta y muy responsable, vive junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos en una comunidad de Choluteca, al sur de Honduras. 
Doña Juana su negocio es la venta de pescado. El préstamo lo necesita para la compra de pescado babosa, rojo, colilla, camarón, pancha, etc. Con el préstamo ella espera que sus ventas aumenten, al tener el producto que los clientes le piden a diario y gracias a esto poder afianzarse un poco mas de ingresos y mejorar el estilo de vida de su familia.
Doña Juana en unos años ella espera que su negocio crezca y sea uno de los más grandes y conocidos de la comunidad y gracias a esto poder seguir apoyando su familia a vivir de una manera honesta y digna. 


Choluteca, Honduras – Noviembre del 2012
texts.en:
Juana is a hardworking, honest, and responsible woman who lives with her husband and two children in the city of Choluteca, in southern Honduras.

Juana sells fish.  She will use the money from this loan to buy babosa, rojo, colilla, camarón, and pancha fish.  With the help of this loan, she expects her sales to increase because she will have the products on hand that her customers request daily, she will have a bit more income, and will be able to improve her family’s quality of life.

Juana hopes that her business will grow within the next few years and become one of the largest and best known in the community so that she can continue supporting her family in an honest and dignified way.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more building materials for her business

loans.name: Ceberino

texts.es: El Señor Ceberino, tiene 34 años de edad conviviente más de 13 años con la señora Severina, ambos con una instrucción de nivel primario, tienen 6 hijos dependientes de los cuales estudian 4, la familia vive en una comunidad rural lejana a 11 km hacia el norte de Colomi. La actividad económica de Don Ceberino y su esposa es la agricultura. Vende papa, papaliza, oca, haba, de esta forma ellos mantienen económicamente a sus hijos en su estudio como también su seguridad alimentaria. Tenían un ahorro que invirtieron en compra de insumos agrícolas. Ellos necesitan un préstamo para comprar una cabeza de ganado vacuno para mejorar su vida y  ayudar en el estudio de sus hijos para que tengan un mejor futuro.
texts.en: Ceberino  is 34 years old and has been married to Severina for 13 years.  Both of them have an elementary school education and have six children whom they support.  All of them attend school.  This family lives in a rural community, located 11 km from Colomi.  Ceberino and his wife are farmers and sell potatoes, papaliza, okra, and beans.  This is how they support themselves and their children’s education.  They had some savings that they invested in farming supplies.  They need this loan to buy a cow.  This will improve their lives and help with their children’s studies so that they will have a better future.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Laura Isabel

texts.es: La Sra. Laura  tiene 19 años, tiene un hijo de la edad de 1 año,  La Sra. Laura,  se dedica a la venta de variedad de dulces y golosinas en la feria de su zona,  este préstamo es su tercera  secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Laura va a usar este préstamo para la compra variedad de dulces para surtir su negocio y  de esta manera brindar variedad de productos a sus clientes,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, La Sra. Laura  va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando productos y así mejorando sus ingresos, su deseo para su negocio es tener un almacén y así brindar un  mejor servicio a su clientela. La Sra. Laura    es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en: Laura is 19 years old and has a one year old son.  She sells a variety of candy and snacks in the fair within her zone.  This will be her third cycle within the institution and will use the money to buy candies to stock her business and offer a variety of products to her customers.  She will use the benefits to continue buying products and in this way increase her profits.  Her desire for her business is to have a store where she can provide better service to her customers.  Laura is a very hardworking lady and she’s happy about the opportunity.

loans.use: to buy candies.

loans.name: Lesbia

texts.es:
La joven Lesbia es una persona trabajadora honesta y muy responsable vive junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos al sur de Honduras. Su negocio es la venta de buche de pescado fresco. 
Doña Lesbia el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de buche de pescado fresco. Con el préstamo ella espera el aumento de sus ventas al tener el producto que los clientes le solicitan a diario y gracias a esto poder generar un poco mas de ingresos para la familia y mejorar así  un poco su estilo de vida. 
Doña Lesbia en unos años ella espera que su negocio crezca y sea el más conocido de la comunidad y con esto poder apoyar a sus hijos para que terminen sus estudios y se conviertan en personas de bien y con mejores oportunidades. 


Choluteca, Honduras –  Noviembre del  2012
texts.en:
Lesbia is a hardworking, honest, and responsible woman who lives with her husband and two children in southern Honduras.  She sells fresh fish.

Lesbia needs this loan to buy fresh fish.  She expects her sales to improve with the help of this loan, because she will have the products on hand that her customers request daily.  This will allow her to generate a bit more income for her family, and allow her to improve her lifestyle.

Lesbia hopes that her business will grow and become better known in her community in a few years, and that she will be able to support her children so that they complete their educations and become persons of means with greater opportunities.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Pedro Pablo

texts.es:
El señor Pedro es una persona responsable, honesta y trabajadora vive junto a su esposa y  sus 4 hijos en comunidad de Choluteca, al sur de Honduras.  
Don Pedro su negocio es la venta de Buche de pescado. El préstamo lo necesita para la compra de buche de pescado, pescado curvina, babosa, y bagre. Con el préstamo el espera que sus ventas aumenten, al tener más productos que ofrecer a los clientes que lo visitan.
Don Pedro  espera mejorar un poco la calidad de vida de su  familia y en un futuro espera que su negocio crezca y gracias a esto poder apoyar a su familia y que sus hijos puedan estudiar y convertirse en personas de bien y con mejores oportunidades.



Choluteca, Honduras – Noviembre  del 2012
texts.en:
Pedro is a responsible, honest person who lives with four children, and lives in the Choluteca community in southern Honduras.

Pedro sells buche fish and will use the money from this loan to buy buche, curvina, babosam and beagre fish.  He expects that his sales will increase with the help of this loan because it will allow him t have more products to offer the customers who visit him.

Pedro expects to improve his family’s quality of life a bit and hopes that his business will grow in the future.  Thanks to this he will be able to support his family and ensure that his children are able to become persons of means, with better opportunities.

loans.use: to buy fish

loans.name: Alto Cochabamba - 32 Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento ALTO COCHABAMBA - 32 está  compuesto por ocho integrantes siete mujeres y un varón,   la presidenta del  banco es la Sra. Dora  tiene 42 años y tiene dos hijos que son de las edades de 12 y 18 años, ella se dedica a la  venta de juguetes en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en una de las calles más concurridas de la ciudad de Cochabamba,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Dora  va a usar este préstamo para compra de juguetes por mayor  para surtir su  negocio ya que esta época tiene mucha venta,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es crecimiento de su negocio, la Sra. Dora  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia ya que en la misma calle donde vende existen varias personas que se dedican a la misma actividad, va a utilizar los beneficios para mejorar sus productos y su calidad de vida. Su deseo  para su negocio es montar una tienda propia y poder exponer la variedad de juguetes que tiene para la venta.
texts.en: The entreprenurial group "Alto Cochabamba - 32" is formed by eight members, seven women and 1 man, the president of the group is Dora, she is 42, has two children ages 12 and 8, she works selling toys in a stand located in one of the busiest streets of the city of Cochabamba, this loan is her first cycle with the institution, Dora is going to use this loan to buy toys at wholesale to stock her business because during this season she has many sales, her reason to request the loan is to grow the business, Dora faces challenges in her business such as competition located in the same street where she sells where there are people working on the same activity she works, she is going to use the benefits to have better products and improve her quality of life.  Her wish for the business is to start her own store and show the variety of toys she has for sale.

loans.use: to buy toys.

loans.name: David Jesus

texts.es: El Sr. Jesús  tiene 31 años, tiene un hijo de la edad de 10 años,  El Sr. Jesús,  se dedica a la venta de variedad de productos en su tienda el ofrece productos como rosarios y velas religiosas ya que esta época de fin de año mucha gente tiene confirmaciones primera comunión y matrimonios por esta razón tiene mucha demanda,   este préstamo es su segunda  secuencia dentro de la institución, El Sr. Jesús  va a usar este préstamo para la compra variedad de velas y rosarios para surtir su negocio y  de esta manera brindar variedad de productos a sus clientes.
texts.en: Jesus is 31 years old and has a ten year old son.  Jesus sells a variety of products, such as rosaries, and religious candles in his store.  During this end of year season, many people have confirmations, first communions, and marriages.  For this reason he has a large demand.  This loan will be his second within the institution.  Jesus will use the money to buy a variety of candles and rosaries to stock his business and provide a variety of products for his customers to choose from.

loans.use: to stock his store.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Primitiva

texts.es: La señora Primitiva, de 50 años de edad, tiene un hijo dependiente que estudia en la universidad. Ellos viven en Colomi, municipio de Cochabamba. La señora  nos cuenta que su esposo le abandono hace más de 5 años, por este motivo ella supo sobrellevar la vida haciendo estudiar a su hijo con una actividad principal de producción agrícola, de papa y papaliza. La Señora Primitiva requiere un préstamo para hacer construir una vivienda en la comunidad de Palta Loma para que vaya a trabajar en la agricultura. Una vez que tenga su vivienda construida tendrá donde quedarse, mejorando su actividad agrícola, así siempre trabajara para ayudar en sus estudio de su hijo hasta que salga profesional y que tenga un futuro mejor que ella.
texts.en: Primitiva is 50 years old and has a son who studies at university.  They live in the Clomi area of Cochabamba.  She says that her husband left her more than five years ago, so she was able to continue living by making her son study and by farming; potatoes and papaliza.  Primitiva needs a loan to build a house in the Palta Loma community where she will farm.  Once she has her house, she will have a place to stay so she can improve her farming.  In this way she will always be able to work so that she can help her son with his studies, so that he can become a professional and have a better future than she did.

loans.use: to build a house.

loans.name: Mariela Del Carmen

texts.es: La joven Mariela del Carmen es habitante del barrio memorial Sandino, soltera sin hijos, su actividad comercial es la pulpería y comideria siempre con el apoyo de su mamá, juntas han logrado salir adelante y como meta está el seguir invirtiendo en mejorar la infraestructura de su casa, está optando por su segundo crédito con Afodenic y KIVA para realizar un cuarto y tener más comodidad e ir ordenando poco a poco su vivienda, con el préstamo comprara cemento, arena, bloques, hierro, perlines, zinc y pagara la mano de obra.
texts.en: Young Mariela del Carmen lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood.  She’s single and has no children.  Her commercial activity is a grocery store and snack bar; her mother helps her always and together they’ve succeeded in getting ahead.  Her goal is to continue investing in home infrastructure improvements so she’s opting for a second Afodenic and KIVA loan to add a room for more comfort and gradually organize her dwelling better.  She will use the loan to buy cement, sand, blocks, rebar, roof purlins, metal sheeting and to pay labor costs.

loans.use: to buy building materials and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
El señor Víctor, vive en la ciudad de Tegucigalpa, está casado, desde hace ocho años que se dedica a la prestación de servicios de transporte taxi, mismo que se encuentra ubicado en un punto estratégico ya que pertenece a uno de los centros comerciales de la ciudad, donde muchas personas solicitan este servicio, es muy trabajador y junto con su esposa decidieron abrir un comedor en su casa de habitación donde ofrecen variedad de comida a sus clientes.
Don Víctor gracias a la buena atención y el delicioso sabor de sus comidas le permiten gozar de muy buena clientela que le visitan a diario, está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de carne, papas, quesos, zanahoria, aguacate, pepino, cebollas, chiles verdes, refrescos, etc. Para surtir mas su negocio en esta temporada navideña, su sueño es que su negocio se mas grande y así poder salir adelante con su familia.


Tegucigalpa, Honduras - Noviembre del 2012
texts.en:
Víctor lives in the city of Tegucigalpa.  He has made a living offering taxi services for eight years.  He's located in a strategic area because it's one of the city's business districts where a lot of people request this service.

He's very hardworking, and he and his wife decided to open a dining room in their house where they offer a variety of food to their customers.  Thanks to his good service and the delicious flavor of his food, Víctor has very good customers who visit him every day.

He's requesting the loan to buy meat, potatoes, cheese, carrots, avocado, cucumber, onion, green chili peppers, soda, etc., to stock his business during this Christmas season.

His dream is for his business to grow so he can get ahead with his family.

Tegucigalpa, Honduras, November 2012

loans.use: to buy food to stock his business

loans.name: Nelso Giovany

texts.es:
El señor Nelson de 37 años de edad es casado, tiene 04 hijos que dependen de el, vive una comunidad de San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras, tiene casa propia  y un taller de ladrillos y tejas, trabaja con su esposa Mirna, que tiene un negocio de venta de golosinas en donde vende por las mañanas.
Don Nelson luego elabora en su taller ladrillos y tejas con la ayuda de dos empleados, está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de tierra, barro y arcilla que son la materia prima para elaborar estos productos. Con el apoyo de este préstamo el pretende suplir la necesidad de financiamiento que necesita en estos momentos para su negocio.
Don Nelson su sueño es trabajar bien en este año en su taller y tener las ventas necesarias para salir adelante con sus compromisos.

 San Lorenzo, Honduras - Noviembre  del 2012.
texts.en:
Señor Nelso, 37 years old, is married, has four children who depend on him, and lives in a community of San Lorenzo in the south of Honduras.  He has his own home and a workshop for bricks and roof tiles.  He works with his wife Mirna, who has a business selling sweets in the mornings.  Don Nelso then prepares bricks and roof tiles in his workshop with the help of two employees.

He is asking for the loan in order to buy dirt, mud, and clay which are the raw materials for making his products.  With the help of the loan he intends to fulfill the financing he needs for his business at this time.  Don Nelso's dream is to have good business in his workshop this year and to have the sales necessary to get ahead with his commitments. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras - November 2012

loans.use: to buy dirt, mud, and clay for his business.

loans.name: Eliana Felisa

texts.es: La Sra. Eliana  tiene 63 años, tiene un hijo mayor ya independiente, ella se dedica a la venta de variedad de refrescos y cerveza en su tienda que se encuentra en la zona de Chasquipampa,  este préstamo es su tercera secuencia dentro de la institución, La Sra. Eliana  va a usar este préstamo para la compra variedad de refrescos y cerveza  por mayor para surtir su puesto de venta   y  de esta manera brindar variedad de productos a sus clientes,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio. La Sra. Eliana  es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en: Señora Eliana is 63, has an older son who is already independent, and makes a living through selling a variety of soda and beer in her shop in the Chasquipampa area.  This loan is her third cycle with the institution.  Señora Eliana is going to use this loan to buy a variety of wholesale soda and beer and in this way offer a variety of products to her customers.  Her reason for requesting the loan is to continue improving her business.  Señora Eliana is a very hard-working person who is happy for the opportunity offered to her.

loans.use: to buy soda and beer.

loans.name: Benito Rene

texts.es:
El señor Benito, vive en la ciudad de Tegucigalpa,  está casado y  tiene dos  hijos dos los cuales tiene estudiando,  desde hace seis años que se dedica a la prestación de servicios de transporte taxi, mismo que se encuentra ubicado en un punto estratégico ya que pertenece a uno de los centros comerciales de la ciudad donde muchas de personas solicitan este servicio.
Don Benito gracias a su negocio ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia ya que se le ha hecho difícil encontrar un empleo, debido al uso diario el vehículo le está presentando problemas y está solicitando el apoyo de un préstamo por la cantidad de L. 10,000.00 lempiras para poder realizarle cambios de llantas, amortiguadores, cambio de aceite, balineras y cables y otros.
Don Benito uno de sus sueños es poder comprar su vivienda ya que actualmente alquila.  


Tegucigalpa, Honduras -  Noviembre del 2012
texts.en:
Benito lives in the city of  Tegucigalpa. He is married and has two children who are in school. For six years, he has worked offering a taxi service. He works at a strategic spot, since it belongs to one of the commercial centers in the city where a lot of people ask for this service. Benito, thanks to his business, has been able to get his family ahead, since it has been difficult to find a job. Due to the daily use of the vehicle, it has been giving him problems  He is asking for the support of a loan of the amount of L.10,000.00 lempiras to be able to change the tires, the shock absorbers, the oil, the bearings, the cables and more.

One of Benito's dreams is to be able to buy a home, because right now he is renting.  


Tegucigalpa, Honduras -  November, 2012

loans.use: to buy tires, shock absorbers,  an oil change, bearings and cables for his business.

loans.name: Carol Patricia

texts.es: La Sra. Carol tiene 30 años y es madre soltera con dos  hijos que tiene la edad de 7 y 12 años, ella se dedica a la venta  de comida, ella vive en la zona 14 de Septiembre,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra.  Carol utilizara este préstamo  para la compra de una heladera para mantener frescas su verduras y frutas, y un horno para preparar alimentos  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de una heladera para conservar sus productos,  la Sra. Carol enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la falta de utensilios falta de mesas y sillas y va a utilizar los beneficios en la compra de variedad de utensilios para ir mejorando su negocio y así generar mayores ingresos.
texts.en: Carol is 30, she is a single mom of two, ages 7 and 12, her activity is the sale of food, she lives in the zone September 14th, this loan is her first cycle in the institution, Carol will use the loan to buy a cooler to keep her fruits and vegetables fresh, and an oven to prepare food.  Her reason to request the loan is that she needs a cooler to keep her products, Carol faces challenges in her business such as the need of tools, tables and chairs; she will use the benefits in buying a variety of tools to improve her business and this way obtain more income.

loans.use: to buy an oven and a cooler.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, blocks, iron, gravel and hire labourers.

loans.name: Noem's Group

texts.en:
Originally from Battambang Province’s Moung Russey District, Noem is 57 years old. He is one breadwinner in the family who needs to raise two children out of eight children, as they are still in school. 

Noem’s income is mainly from five hectares of rice-cropping and two hectares of long bean-growing. He is able to make almost 27,000 KHR per day to cover the daily necessity expenses in the family. 

Noem’s original loan was one of his three cycle loans, which he completely repaid back already. The past subsequent loans have helped him to better support his business and relieve his family’s burden. 

Now, Noem forms a group of four members and he is in his fourth-cycle loan. He is the group leader and is applying for 1,400,000 KHR. As the leader, he is going to use his portion to pay for harvesting fees, potash purchasing and labor costs. 

He hopes that this purchase will support his business on time and get back to him triple yield; thereby, he can upgrade his standard of living for his children’s sake.

loans.use: to pay for harvesting fees, potash purchasing, and labor costs.

loans.name: Sareoun

texts.en:
Sareoun, 45 years old, is a citizen living in a rural village of Battambang Province’s Moung Russey District in Cambodia. She is married and a mother of four children, all of whom are school-aged and still under her responsibility. 

To earn income for the family, Sareoun works as a rice farmer, while her husband works as a fisherman. Together, they are able to earn approximately 35,000 KHR per day and manage to save about 25,000 KHR after offsetting the daily cost of living. 

Sareoun has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for six loan cycles already, with which she succeeded in increasing the family’s income and sending her children to school. This has made her so satisfied. 

Sareoun is now seeking a KHR 2,500,000 loan to harvest rice and buy a boat machine for her husband’s fish-catching business. 

Sareoun hopes to be able to earn even more income generated by her business and her husband’s, so that she can use the anticipated income to further educate her beloved children.

loans.use: to harvest rice and buy a boat machine for her husband’s fish-catching business.

loans.name: Sreng

texts.en:
Sreng, who is from a low-income family, was photographed at the side of her thatched house situated in Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. She lives with her family and operates a farming business. She has been engaged in a rice farming business for more than 10 years. Her husband helps her in farming and uses his remaining time on fishing activities. Together, they generate approximately 4 USD per day. Sreng is 30 years old, married, and the mother of 3 children. 

Sreng is coming to HKL again for her third loan due to insufficient finances. She is now requesting a loan in the sum of 1,700,000 KHR to supplement her capital in order to purchase timbers, planks of wood, and nails to repair and renovate her house. She hopes to have her house finished soon.

loans.use: to purchase timbers, planks of wood, and nails to repair and renovate her house

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en: Marcelina is from Solana and has been operating a farming business for over 10 years now. She usually gains P10,000 during each harvest season twice a year, which goes towards school expenses. She is married and has three children. Marcelina wants to improve her crop production, which is why she is asking for a loan of P20,000 to buy fertilizers and pesticides used in farming. This will help her maintain healthy crops and save funds for future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticicides used in farming

loans.name: Yoem

texts.en:
Yoem lives in the Dongkor district with her family. She has two children who both work in the industrial sector and help support the family with their monthly salary. Yoem, their 37-year-old mother, doesn’t rely on their income, however. She makes and sells different kinds of Khmer cakes to generate her own income of $4 US per day. She has been operating this business for a few years and has been recognized by her neighbors. 

Yoem would like to take out a loan of $1,500 US to purchase a motorcycle to support her children in their transportation needs. This would allow them to reduce their daily costs and to save up for future household use. Yoem believes that the loan will surely enable them to satisfy their living needs.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle to support her children's transportation needs.

loans.name: Batsaikhan

texts.en:
Mrs. Batsaikhan, 46 years old, lives with her family in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in a house on their own land. Her two children both study at the university. 

In 2002, she and her husband purchased a service pavilion, and until now they were renting this pavilion to other people. She also has a taxi service. The automobile used for the taxi service has deteriorated badly over the years, so she is requesting the loan of 1,550,000 MNT to repair her automobile. The repairs include full painting, a new pipe, and front side changing. By doing so, the repaired automobile can be used again for the taxi service and it will improve consumer satisfaction and in return increase the family’s income. In the near future, she has an objective of purchasing a new automobile and building a service object on her pavilion.

loans.use: to repair her automobile

loans.name: Oun's Group

texts.en:
A 39-year-old married woman named Oun is a villager living in a rural village of Thmor Koul district, located in Battambang province, Cambodia. She is blessed with two dependent daughters, both of whom are school-aged. Oun earns a living by farming rice on a two-hectare plot of farmland, while her husband works as a paid worker to add more income to the family. Together, they are able to earn around 34,000KHR per day. 

This will be Oun’s second time requesting a loan via VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The first loan she obtained (and successfully paid back) has helped her to secure food needs for her family. Now she is leading a loan group of two female members to apply for a loan in the amount of 2,000,000KHR in total. Oun, with her requested loan portion, will spend it on buying fertilizer to help keep her rice field in good shape. Oun’s biggest hope is to be able to educate her beloved school-aged children as far as possible so that they will reach their potential as youths in the society.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Suon

texts.en:
Suon, 31, is a widowed mother of a child. She and her child live with her older sister in a house located in a suburb of Phnom Penh. She has been involved as a market vendor for a year selling grocery items from a rented booth of a local market. Most of her customers are people living in her neighborhood who come to the market every day. From this business, Suon is able to make around 10 USD per day, which she usually utilizes to buy food and pay for the education fees of her child.

Suon is requesting an 800 USD loan to buy more inventory for her store so that she can satisfy her customers’ needs and increase her sales. With the support from the loan, she will purchase items like spices, ingredients, vegetables, biscuits, toiletries, cosmetics, and other miscellaneous things. Suon hopes that she can serve her customers with a wide variety of products and obtain higher profits to better her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase items like spices, ingredients, vegetables, biscuits, toiletries, cosmetics, and other miscellaneous things for her store

loans.name: Uuganbayar

texts.en:
Mr. Uuganbayar, 26 years old, lives with his wife and child in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides on his relative’s plot of land. Since 2011, he has been working as an assistant driller for a private business entity that runs geological research, drilling, and trading. Due to work requirements, he often goes to rural areas to assist in drilling processes. After working in this company for three years and studying at Technology University for three months, he can become a master driller. Also in his free time, he renders a taxi service to local residents. 

His wife studies at a one year human resources course and due to lack of finances, she didn’t pay her tuition fee and the family also needs some basic furniture. So he is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to pay for his wife’s tuition fee and to buy some furniture such as a table, chair, and sofa. By doing so, the family can live in a comfortable place and his wife can get her certificate of human resource management, thus enabling her to find a job. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who aspires to advance his career.

loans.use: to pay for his wife's tuition fees and buy some furniture

loans.name: Chheng

texts.en:
Chheng, 70, lives with her spouse in her own home, along with five children, one of whom is married. Chheng has made a living by growing vegetables and rice on her existing farmland. She has been doing this for over 40 years. Her husband is the one who is always helpful in every piece of work she does. 

To gain good transportation for collecting her vegetable crops from the fields and bringing them to the market, Chheng would like to borrow some funds from Kiva lenders in order to purchase a pulled trailer. It is going to cost 300 USD. With this loan, Chheng will meet the financial needs of her business and improve her ways of reaching her goals. Chheng dreams of having a suitable house for her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a pulled trailer to transport her vegetable crops

loans.name: Phalla

texts.en:
Phalla resides in a rural area of Moung Russey district, located in Battambang province, in Cambodia. Phalla is 24 years of age and married. She also is the mother of a son and a daughter, both of whom are dependent on her and currently in school. To continually support the family, Phalla has been working tirelessly as a rice farmer, on a seven-hectare plot of farmland, for around ten years. Phalla’s husband provides a service, repairing and washing motors, in order to complement the income. This couple is able to earn approximately 38,000 KHR daily. 

This is Phalla’s first time requesting a loan via VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is seeking a 3,000,000 KHR loan to support her rice-growing business, by purchasing fertilizer and rice seed. She will also use this loan to buy spare parts for the motor-repairing business of her husband. After receiving and effectively using the requested loan, Phalla hopes that she and her husband can smoothly run the businesses, generating more income to the family. She wants to use the anticipated profit to improve her family’s lifestyle and further educate her beloved children.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and seed for her farm, and motor parts for her husband's motor-repairing business.

loans.name: Loel

texts.en:
Loel is a high school graduate, a widower, and has three children. He has been acting as both a father and mother to his children for ten years. Loel worked as seafarer but since his wife died due to breast cancer, he can no longer go back for work because he must stay with his three children.

Loel owns one hectare of a rice field. He has been engaged in this kind of business since he was 17 years old. Since he worked as a seafarer, he let his wife manage his rice farm. But now, he solely cultivates his farmland. Loel would like to ask for additional capital amounting to PHP20,000, which will be used to buy farm inputs, such as fertilizers and insecticides for his farming business. He knows that through this loan, he can further educate his three children and improve their way of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides for his farming business

loans.name: Noeu

texts.en:
Noeu, 45 years old, lives with her spouse and two children in Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. She is very industrious and has a strong commitment to improving her farming business as it’s her sole source of income. Noeu has been farming for over 12 years. Her spouse, who also farms, raises more profit by climbing palm trees for juice, which is sold in their neighborhood.

For the overall welfare of the family, Noeu is applying for a loan through HKL to purchase rice to store for food. She will use the remaining funds to buy a bamboo ladder for her husband to use to climb palm trees. Noeu dreams of having a suitable house roofed with tiles.

loans.use: to purchase rice to store for food.

loans.name: Marium

texts.en:
Ms. Marium is a 24-year-old married lady who has been successfully running her business of mat (carpet) sales in her community for many years. She buys various colors of mats in different sizes and then sells them in her vicinity and in the local market. At the time she has retained many customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income. Her husband is a government servant with low salary income. She is a mother of four children; one of her sons is not in a good health. That’s why she started her business, to earn good profit to manage her household and the medical expenses of her son as well.

To cope with the increasing demand of her customers, Ms. Marium needs to purchase more mats in different colors and sizes by taking into account the choice of her customers. For this, she contacted Kashf foundation and applied for a loan of 25,000 PKR. She is in her third loan cycle and has shown good repayment history. She expects a boost in her earnings through her large sales. She dreams of expanding her business in the future to better support the needs of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more mats in different colors and sizes by taking into account the choice of her customers.

loans.name: Zaib

texts.en: Mrs. Zaib is 22 years old, a married woman, and a mother of one. She has been running a sewing business for seven years.  She started sewing at the age of 15, and now she excels in her field. Her husband works in a private bank, but his income is not sufficient to meet the daily expenses of the family members alone. She is motivated to provide for her family, and she makes enough to lead a decent life. She has maintained many regular customers and has become famous in her community. In order to complete orders on time, she needs to purchase a new sewing machine with spools of threads in different colors. For this, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs 20,000. She is expecting a boost in her net income and wishes to spend a part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine with spools of threads in different colors

loans.name: Shakeela

texts.en: Ms Shakeela is a 45 year old married woman and a mother of six children. She has been running a business selling milk for many years. She has retained many regular customers in her vicinity. She always plays her role in provision of financial support to her family. A few years ago, her husband became ill and was no longer able to work, that’s why she initiated her business to provide full support to her family as a sole earner. She works day and night and is earning a good profit from this business. She is quite a determined lady and never loses hope in any sort of circumstances. She planned to enhance her business, her sister-in-law told her about financial services of Kashf Foundation, and so she applied for a loan of 15000 PKR for the first time.  She intends to utilize the loan amount along with her past savings to purchase another buffalo to inflate her sales. It will improve her earnings and will enable her to better support the needs of the family members.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to inflate her sales.

loans.name: Perveen

texts.en:
Ms. Perveen is 36 years old, a married woman and a mother of two children. She has been successfully running a business of bottle sales for many years. She buys a large quantity of bottles in different sizes from the market. After doing proper cleaning she sells them in her community and in the local market. These bottles are then filled with medicines and syrups. She earns good profit though her business and contributes enough to the family income. Her husband is happy with the support of her business in managing their household.  

In order to purchase more bottles in different sizes and packs of cleaning products in large quantity she requested for a loan of Rs. 20,000 from Kashf Foundation for the second time.  This will enable her to meet with the increasing demand of her customers efficiently. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more bottles in different sizes and packs of cleaning products in large quantity.

loans.name: Han's Group

texts.en: Han, 45 years old, is a citizen living in a rural area of Moung Russey district located in Battambang province, Cambodia. She is married and a mother of two children. To support the family, Han has a business farming rice and planting vegetables, earning around 24,000 KHR per day. Han, a fourth-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), is leading a group member who is a first-time borrower to take out a loan in the amount of 1,800,000 KHR in total. The group leader Han states that with the previous loans she was able to improve the living standard of her family. With this new requested loan portion, Han will buy more fertilizer. In the future, this hard-working woman plans on buying more plots of farmland to expand her business, generating more income for the family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Uk

texts.en:
Uk is 25 years old, a resident living in Kompong Speu province. Uk is a hardworking man who currently works for a garment factory and also operates farming on his own farmland. Since he started working in the factory, Uk has met his wife and they happily got married. This couple doesn’t have any children yet but they plan to have one next year. Together, they can make around 8.00 USD to support their living.

Uk is now taking out a loan through HKL, a longstanding Kiva partner, to purchase a couple of cows for the maintenance of the rice fields. He mentioned that the two cows will help him in his farm work and also cut down his operation costs. For his future plan, Uk will save his income partially for the expansion of his farming business.

loans.use: to purchase a couple of cows for the maintenance of the rice fields.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma’s priority in life is to send her children in school until they finish college and hold a degree. Emma is 44 years of age, married and has five school age children. Her husband is her partner in managing her business. She and her husband sell plastic wares and kitchen wares in different villages. 
Emma wishes to expand the products she sells to increase her income which she will use to attain her priority in life. She wanted to borrow a loan of 50,000 PHP to buy basins and some glassware products to sell. She hopes to avail the loan and expand the products she sells to gain income to further support her children's needs in school.

loans.use: to buy basins and some glassware products to sell.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.en:
Wilfredo is 32 years old, married, and has three children. He and his wife manage a footwear business. They sell shoes, slippers and sandals in different municipalities on market days. His approximate income per month from the business is P10,000. 

Wilfredo started using capital that was borrowed from his sister. His determination to grow the business pushes him to work hard and manage the business well. Wilfredo wants to buy the products he sells in volume to minimize his expenses in purchasing the products but he doesn’t have enough capital to do this. Wilfredo decided to borrow a loan of P50,000 to buy various styles of shoes, slippers and sandals to sell in different municipalities. Wilfredo wishes for the growth of his business.

loans.use: to buy various styles of shoes, slippers and sandals to sell in different municipalities.

loans.name: Apollo

texts.en:
Apollo dreams of having his own stall for his business to minimize his expenditures in renting a stall. He doubles his efforts to grow his business faster and reach his dream. 

Apollo is 43 years of age, married and blessed with two children. His wife is his partner in managing their restaurant business. They have three assistants in running the business. Apollo has been in this business for eight years. He wants to extend his business to gain more profits and make his dream a reality. Apollo is asking for a loan of 50,000 PHP to buy spices, meat and vegetables to cook. He hopes to extend the business by availing this loan.

loans.use: to buy spices, meat and vegetables to cook.

loans.name: Zubaida

texts.en:
Ms. Zubaida is a 48–year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a boutique in her area for the last one year. She offers a variety of dresses by considering the taste and choice of her customers. Due to her business, she is well known in her community and makes enough to lead a decent life. Her husband is working as a laborer and earns insufficient income to support his family alone. Her two daughters also assist her in business.

Ms. Zubaida is a mother of five children. She is motivated to provide for her family. She wants to grow her business and for that she wants to buy more variety of clothes in different colors and designs to add to her collection for the upcoming eve of Christmas. So she requested a loan of 30,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation. She has been in association with Kashf for five years and has shown excellent repayment behavior. She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to deal with her daily expenditures and also for the better growth of her children.

loans.use: to buy more variety of clothes in different colors and designs to add to her collection for the upcoming eve of Christmas.

loans.name: Ki

texts.en:
Ki is 40 years of age. She is married with five children and they live together in Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province. Ki owns a few plots of farmland surrounding her house, where she grows rice and gathers her harvest seasonally. Aside from her hardship, Ki could serve food to her family throughout the entire year. Ki has additional income generated from fishing activities, which are conducted by her spouse and some of her children.

For the overall well-being of her family, Ki would like to have fresh water for consumption and drinking. That’s why she is requesting a loan through HKL to dig a well for the household. It’s going to cost 2,000,000 KHR, but Ki just needs an amount of 1,600,000 KHR from Kiva to add to her existing capital to cover the costs. She hopes that she will be able to keep her family in healthier conditions.

loans.use: to dig a well for clean water

loans.name: Peov

texts.en:
The land in the Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province is very favorable for growing different types of crops and tropical fruits to supply the entire country.  Peov, aged 42, as well as other villagers, are engaged in agricultural businesses, focusing on planting seasonal crops and rice for their sources of income. Peov has been operating her farming business since 2000, with constant help from her spouse and a couple of her children.

Peov has requested a loan of $500 US to plant corn again. This will enable her to buy corn seeds to sow on a few hectares of her farmland. Peov believes that, with her efforts, she will have an abundant harvest in the coming season.

loans.use: to invest in planting corn.

loans.name: Sang

texts.en:
Sang, 44 years old, is a hardworking woman who has been married and has six children. She currently resides in the Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province. Sang was born and raised on a low-income family farm and didn’t have a good education. She helped her parents farm and has been farming ever since. After she was married, the family pursued farming as their main income to support themselves and their children’s education.

Due to a shortage of funds to buy necessary items to grow rice next season, Sang decided to borrow a loan from Kiva lenders to cover her operating costs. She will also use a portion of the loan to pay the construction laborers who just finished building her ground-floor room. In the future, Sang anticipates having a wide farmland for plentiful rice production.

loans.use: to buy necessary items to grow rice

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en: Ms Tahira is a 30-year-old married woman and a proud owner of a small grocery store in her community. When Tahira suggested the idea of a self-owned business to her husband, he rejected it by saying that she lacks the knowledge and ability to do anything independently. Adamant on proving him wrong, Tahira borrowed money from her brother and injected it into a newly-formed grocery store. Today she is famous in her community for running a store that provides perishables to many households. She has five children, and three are currently attending school. Her current business cash flows do not allow her to enroll her remaining two children in school. Tahira now wishes to increase the amount of inventory in her store by purchasing more packs of beverages, oil, and milk. She has requested a loan worth PKR 30,000. This will enable her to cater to her customers efficiently without delay, which will ultimately help in generating more cash at home.

loans.use: to purchase more packs of beverages, oil, and milk for her grocery store

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana has mastered the art of making woolen clothes at home. Over the past three years she has used her skill to help support her family. 

She has a simple loom (a device used to weave sweater) at home and works on it throughout the week, hoping to satisfy retailers in the local market.  Rukhsana has retained many regular customers.  

Now she has approached Kashf because she wishes to purchase a new loom with bundles of wool in different colors, that will help increase her productivity. 

She has applied for a loan worth Rs20,000 and is confident she will increase sales by twofold after this cash injection.

loans.use: to purchase a new loom with bundles of wool in different colors.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy toffees and candies to sell

loans.name: Salveregina

texts.en:
Salveregina is 42 years of age and married.  She raises her five children from the profits of her sari-sari (convenience) store business.  

She sells soft drinks, biscuits, candies and spices in their village.  Salveregina’s goal is to earn a higher income to sustain her children needs in school.  Her plan is to expand the products she sells to her customers. 

Salveregina’s husband is a tricycle operator for passenger’s transportation.   

Salveregina greatest wish is to help her children finish their college education and become professionals someday.  She wants them to hold the degree for immediate employment for better future. 

She is requesting a loan of P40,000 to buy can goods, breads and beverages to sell.

loans.use: to buy can goods, breads and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en: Mohammed is 32 years old and lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He is a good man and knows how to treat his clients well. He is married and the father of four children, to whom he has always wished to give a good education, offering them the best he can. He has been operating an optical business. He received and repaid a previous loan from AMB and is now seeking a second loan to increase the variety of glasses in his shop and meet his clients' needs. He has applied for a loan of 500,000 YER from AMB to buy a variety of lenses and glasses for his business. He appreciates Kiva 's financing him on the first loan. He hopes to own a house.

loans.use: to buy lenses and glasses for his business, so that he can meet his clients' needs.

loans.name: Sadia

texts.en:
Ms Sadia is a 25-year-old married lady and the proud owner of a beauty parlor. For 6 years, Sadia worked as a helping hand in a parlor near her house and gained enough experience to start her own business. When Sadia wished to take a loan to start a new business, her husband was against the idea of going into debt and was doubtful about Sadia’s ability to repay it. However, Sadia was confident in her experience and borrowed from Kashf as her friend in the neighborhood told her about Kashf and its efforts in their community. 

Her hard work has increased customer traffic in her parlor to an extent that she applied to borrow Rs 30,000 so she can prepare two dressing stations that require a chair, a table, a mirror, and a few new accessories.  In this way, she will be able to cater to more customers time after time.

loans.use: to purchase two chairs and tables, a mirror, and a few new accessories.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim works from home and earns enough income to support her family.  She purchases elastic from the wholesale market on a weekly basis and packs it in different quantities as requested by retailers. 

Once she brings the material in her house she cuts in it different lengths and wraps it around paper boards and then covers it in plastic paper. 

Shamim is now finding it difficult to meet the demands of her retailers as orders are increasing in volume.  She has requested to borrow Rs15,000 and wishes to purchase a machine that will help her cut the materials.  She also wants to increase the quantity purchased from the wholesaler. 

Shamim is eager to expand her business as any additional income will be spending on her five children, to improve their future.

loans.use: to purchase a machine that will help her cut materials and to buy more materials.

loans.name: Arcelie

texts.en:
Arcelie is a widowed mother with two children.  She dream to buy and owned a stall.  At present, she is renting a stall where she operates her beauty salon business.  She has eight years of experience. To gain extra income she also sells soft drinks, candies and curls in her beauty salon stall.

Besides hair cutting, she wants to offer hair straightening to satisfy her customers.  Arcelie is asking for a loan of P50,000 to buy materials and some cosmetics products for her business. 

She hopes that someday her dream will come true.  She will continue working hard to reach her dream.

loans.use: to buy materials and some cosmetics products.

loans.name: Uzma

texts.en:
Ms Uzma is a 22-year-old married woman and a mother of three. She has expertise in the field of embroidery and is providing unique and attractive embroidered clothes to two famous boutiques in the city area. The retailers wait for her to bring in her well prepared inventory, and they pay her well for her hard work. She makes enough profit through her business.  

In order to cope with the increasing demand of her customers she requested a loan of Rs 30,000 and wishes to purchase a new wooden frame, beads, threads, and tussles. She has been in association with Kashf for two years and has shown excellent repayment behavior. She dreams of providing quality education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase a new wooden frame, beads, threads, and tussles.

loans.name: Khalid

texts.en: Khalid is a happy man who treats everyone well because he has opportunities to get ahead. He is a policeman. He is 36 years old and lives with his two children in Sana'a, Yemen. He receives a low salary and works hard to cover his family's expenses  So he has applied for a loan of 350,000 YER from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank to buy a bus. He hopes to have a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy a bus.

loans.name: Jonaliza

texts.en:
A woman with strong determination to succeed in her business and the ability to improve their living conditions, Jonaliza is striving for the benefit of her children. Jonaliza is 34 years old, has two children, and is married. Her husband is an overseas worker in the Middle East.
Jonaliza engages in direct sales and earns 25% on the products she purchases. Jonaliza sells shoes, apparel, and some ready-to-wear products. Jonaliza wants to deliver her costumers’ orders on time, but she is short on funds to make immediate purchases of the things her costumers order. In this connection, Jonaliza is requesting a loan of PHP 50,000 to make a payment on her purchase of shoes and apparel. Someday, Jonaliza hopes to see her dreams come true.

loans.use: to make a payment on her purchase order of shoes and apparel.

loans.name: Veronika

texts.en:
Ms Veronika, a 43-year-old married mother of two daughters and a son, is striving hard to meet their food, clothing, and health needs. Her husband is employed in a small surgical industry, but his income is not sufficient to meet the daily expenditures of the family. Well familiar with stitching techniques, Veronika started her sewing business three years ago to contribute to the family income.

Veronica initiated her business with the support of Kashf Foundation, having taken her first loan to buy a sewing machine. At present, she enjoys a great client list and has gained a lot of appreciation and popularity in her community. She has requested a loan of Rs 20000 to buy a stock of threads of various colors, buttons, needles, etc. These purchases will enable Veronika to meet the demands of her customers without fail.

loans.use: to buy a stock of threads of various colors, buttons, needles, etc.

loans.name: Azra

texts.en: Ms. Azra is 43 years old. She is a married woman and a mother of five. She has been making clay pots with her husband for 15 years. The man shown in the photo is Azra’s husband. They started their business from a very small level and expanded it gradually. They have become popular in their area for providing the best quality pots in different sizes.  In order to purchase high-quality mud, clay powder and buckets of paints in various colors, Azra contacted the Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs 30,000. It would help her to meet their orders on time. She has been in association with Kashf for four years and has shown an excellent repayment history. She wishes to spend part of her profits on improving the standard of living for her family members.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality mud, clay powder, and buckets of paints in various colors

loans.name: Touba Cadior Group

texts.fr:
Le banc villageois de Touba Cadior est inauguré le 12/5/2010. Ce groupe est constitué de 21 femmes en bonne entente et qui habitent le même quartier.

La présidente de ce groupe, Fatou est une femme mariée de 37 ans avec une fille en sa charge. Elle fait du petit commerce. Elle vend des chaussures, pochettes. Elle fait aussi de l'embouche. Elle achète ses articles au marché Pétersen de Dakar et revend à Sagatta. Sur la photo, elle est habillée en rose et a la main levée.

Avec son prêt, elle voudrait 02 moutons à 70000F et avec le reste de l'argent elle va acheter des marchandises pour son commerce.

Avec ses bénéfices, elle renforce ses épargnes afin d'obtenir un prêt plus grand pour assurer l'avenir de sa fille.
texts.en:
The Touba Caior village bank was formed on 12/5/2010.  The group has 21 female members who live in the same neighborhood and get on well together.

The president of this group, Fatou, is a married woman of 37 who has one daughter in her care.  Her business is buying and selling.  She sells shoes and clutch bags.  She also fattens animals.  She buys her goods in Petersen market, in Dakar, and makes her sales in Sagatta.  In the photo, she is dressed in pink and has her hand raised.

Fatou would like to use 70,000 francs of this loan to buy two sheep and the rest to buy merchandise for her sales business.

With the profits she makes from her business, Fatou strengthens her savings so that she can take out a larger loan and thereby guarantee her daughter's future.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es: Edgar de 30 años de edad es un hombre trabajador y con grandes proyectos de negocio. Durante muchos años se dedicó a la minería, pero debido al orden público de la zona decidió retirase y  con sus ahorros montar su propio negocio de comercialización de accesorios para minería, aprovechando sus conocimientos en el área. Labora los siete días de la semana de 6 de la mañana a 8 de la noche. Su mayor sueño es poder consolidar su negocio e incrementar su nivel de ventas, ya que esta es su única fuente de ingresos, con la cual sostiene a su esposa y a su hijo de 4 años de edad.  Edgar se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de material de construcción para su ferretería con el propósito de incrementar su rentabilidad y ofrecerle a su familia una estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Edgar, age 30, is hardworking and has ambitious plans for his business.  He worked for many years in the mining industry, but left it due to security problems there.  With his savings he started his own business in which he sells mining equipment and supplies, making good use of his knowledge in this area.  He works seven days per week from 6 am to 8 pm.

His greatest dream is to be able to strengthen his business and increase his sales.  His sales income is the only source of income on which he supports his wife and four-year-old child.  Edgar is requesting a loan to buy construction materials for his mining equipment store with the purpose of increasing its profitability and offering his family economic stability.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en: Ms. Sakina is a 31-year-old married woman and a mother of three children. She has been manufacturing carpets for many years. She offers various handmade carpets and is famous within her circle for providing good quality products. She is happily doing it for the sake of her family. She is trying hard to fulfill their demands, which include food, health, clothing, and education. This is her third year with Kashf Foundation. She is satisfied with the support from the Kashf Foundation and has applied for a loan of PKR 20,000 to purchase good quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibers. In this way her business will flourish more and will ultimately help her to support her family well.

loans.use: to purchase good quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibers for her carpet-making business

loans.name: Juan Anesio

texts.es:
Juan tiene 74 años de edad de estado civil soltero no tiene hijos vive con los padres en el Recinto EL JOBO perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. 

Pertenece a la Ventanilla NUEVO JERUSALEN se encuentra ubicada el  recinto EL JOBO, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias. Juan se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. 

Con el crédito podrá comprar insumos como: fertilizantes, abonos, insecticidas para evitar las plagas y enfermedades. Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de Ventanas. El crédito le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos y los cultivos. 

El sueño es comprar una bomba para matar las plagas y comprar un sistema de riego para el tiempo de verano. En los tiempos libres le gusta hacer deporte como caminar y trotar.
texts.en:
Juan is 74 years old, unmarried and he doesn’t have children.  He lives with his parents in the area of El Jobo which belongs to the canton of Ventanas in the province of Los Ríos.

He belongs to the “Nuevo Jerusalén” communal bank, located in the area El Jobo, belonging to the canton of Ventanas, which is engaged in the work of agriculture and livestock.  Juan dedicates himself to agriculture, planting corn and rice.

With the loan he will be able to buy supplies like fertilizer, manure and insecticides to prevent pests and disease.  He will make the purchases in the city of Ventanas.  The loan will help him to increase his revenue and crops. 

His dream is to buy a fumigation bomb to kill pests and to buy an irrigation system for the summer.  

In his free time he likes to walk and jog for sport.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, manure and insecticides to prevent pests and disease.

loans.name: Rabia

texts.en:
Ms. Rabia is a 20-year-old married woman who has been successfully running a small electronics shop with her husband. The man shown in the photo is Rabia’s husband. 

They have been doing it together for the past five years and by this time, they have gained many customers. They offer various electronic items like switches, electronic buttons, decks etc. In order to improve her business, Rabia contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs. 20,000 to purchase bundles of wires, switchboards, and buttons to consistently meet with the increasing demand at her store. 

She shared that micro-finance services enabled her to improve the standard of living of her family. Rabia is thankful to Kashf for its support.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wires, switchboards and buttons to meet with the increasing demand at her store

loans.name: Libardo Antonio

texts.es: Libardo Antonio de 62 años de edad, es un hombre casado y con nueve hijos, su mayor virtud es su recursividad, ésta, dice él, es la que le ha permitido sacar adelante a sus hijos. Hace 7 meses decidió cerrar su puesto de legumbres en la plaza de mercado de su pueblo, debido a que le estaba generando perdidas por la alta competencia. Tomó la decisión de colocar una tienda en su casa ya que su negocio es la única fuente de ingresos para el sostenimiento del hogar. En este momento se encuentra solicitando un crédito para la compra de surtido, para abastecer su negocio y aumentar el nivel de ventas mejorando su calidad de vida. Su mayor deseo es poder vivir tranquilo sin que su familia tenga que pasar necesidades.
texts.en:
Libardo Antonio is sixty-two years old and is married with nine children.  His greatest virtue is his persistence.  This, he says, is what has allowed him to continue moving forward with his children.  

Seven months ago, he decided to close his vegetable stall in the market in his town, since he was generating losses due to the high competition.  He made the decision to put a shop in his home, since his business is the only source of income for sustaining his home.  

Presently, he is requesting a loan to buy merchandise, in order to supply his business and to increase the level of sales, thereby improving the quality of life.  His greatest wish is to be able to live peacefully without his family having to pass up needs.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, like grain, pasta, snacks, and drinks.

loans.name: Riaz

texts.en:
Ms Riaz is a 47-year-old married woman who has been selling stitching materials for 12 years to support her husband. She offers different laces, ribbons, threads, and buttons in different colors. She became popular in her street for providing good material to her customers. Her husband's income is insufficient to meet with the family's expenses. She needs to contribute to the family income to meet the expenses of her household with the educational needs of her children. 

She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. She is in her second loan cycle and applied a loan of Rs. 20,000 to purchase lace, buttons, and spools of threads in different colors. It will improve her earning and enable her to better support the needs of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase lace, buttons, and spools of threads in different colors.

loans.name: Umedjon

texts.ru:
Умед молодой парень в возрасте 29 лет.  Он женат имеет одного ребенка. Жена занимается хозяйством и воспитанием своего ребенка.
 Сам Умед занимается деканством почти уже 7 лет. У него в собственности имеется 4-га земли в котором он выращивает лук и зерновые культуры. В свободное время он занимается частным извозом сена. Но деньги которые он зарабатывает частным извозом уходят  на проживание  семьи.  Для расширения своей деятельности  а точнее выращивание  зерновых культур Умед обратился в организацию Кива.
  На полученный кредит Умед хочет закупить семена и минеральные удобрения. Он очень рад, что существуют такие организации как Кива, и что с помощью таких организации люди с низким и средним слоям населения могут осуществлять свои планы.    
 Заранее благодарит Кива за поддержку и понимание.
texts.en:
Umedjon is a young man, aged 29. He is married and has one child. His wife takes care of the house and raises their child. Umedjon himself has been a dekhan farmer for more than 7 years. He owns 4 hectares of land himself, where he grows onions and corn. In his spare time he carts hay privately. However, the money he earns from carting privately goes to the family's living costs. 

To broaden his business and more precisely the growing of corn, Umedjon turned to Kiva. For the loan received, Umedjon would like to purchase seeds and fertilizers. He is very happy that an organization like Kiva exists, and that with the help of this kind of organization people in the low and middle class of the population can realize their plans. He thanks Kiva in advance for the support and understanding.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Touba Cadior Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe faisant partie du Banc Villageois "TOUBA CADIOR" est constitué de 2 femmes.

La présidente, Ndéye Lissa, est une femme mariée de 29 ans sans enfant. Elle a sa sœur en charge. Elle fait du petit commerce de mèche, greffage, chaussures et sacs. Elle s'approvisionne à la capital. Elle mène cette activité depuis plus de 03 ans. Sur la photo, elle est à droite et a la main levée.

Avec son prêt, elle voudrait acheter des marchandises (mèche, greffage, chaussures et sacs) pour les préparatifs d'une grande cérémonie religieuse de sa localité

Avec ses bénéfices, elle subvient à ses besoins personnels et ceux de sa sœur et renforce également son épargne au niveau de son banc villageois.
texts.en:
This group, part of the TOUBA CADIOR Banc Villageois, is made up of two women.

The leader of the group, Ndéye Lissa, is 29 years old and married. She has no children but takes care of her sister. She is involved in small retail business, selling hair extensions, hair weaves, shoes and bags.  She buys her goods in the capital city and has been involved in this activity for more than three years.  In the photo, she is the woman raising her hand, on the right-hand side. 

With her loan, she would like to buy goods such as hair extensions, hair weaves, shoes and bags, in preparation for an important religious ceremony in her locality.

Her profits allow her to meet her personal needs and those of her sister, and to strengthen her savings within the Banc Villageois.

loans.use: to buy goods such as hair extensions, hair weaves, shoes and bags.

loans.name: José Horacio

texts.es: José tiene 65 años de edad y lo que le sobran son motivaciones para salir cada día a vender sus dulces en su puesto de trabajo, ubicado en frente de un colegio del municipio de Rionegro, Colombia. El dinero que reúne gracias a sus ventas lo destina para solventar la situación económica de su familia, debido a que en ocasiones esa es una de las mayores dificultades que afrontan. Su mayor deseo es mejorar la calidad de vida en su hogar, que nunca falte la comida y la ropa para vestir. En el momento se encuentra solicitando un crédito para la compra de surtido con el fin de incrementar las ventas  y generar mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
José is 65 years old. He is extremely motivated to go out to work each day outside of the city high school in Rionegro, Colombia and sell snacks from his stand. The money that he earns from his sales allows him to help his family get through some financial difficulties they are facing. His biggest dream is to improve the quality of life in his home so that his family would never lack food or clothes to wear. 

Now, José is requesting this loan in order to buy items to stock his stand with, so he can increase his sales and generate more profit.

loans.use: to buy candy and snacks.

loans.name: Maria Marleny

texts.es: María Marleny de 51 años de edad, ha laborado desde que era una adolescente debido a crítica situación económica de su familia. Aprendió a rebuscarse la vida en diferentes tiendas de  su localidad, allí aprendió el oficio de las ventas. Posteriormente se casó y se dedicó a las labores del hogar. Con la llegada de su hijo, los ingresos eran insuficientes para cubrir las necesidades de la familia por lo cual ella decidió montar en su casa una tienda para colaborarle a su cónyuge con los gastos. Se encuentra solicitando un crédito que destinará en la compra de surtido, vitrinas y estanterías para mejorar la locación del negocio y ampliar la oferta de productos. Su Mayor deseo es que la tienda comience a generar mayores ingresos con el fin de mejorar la situación económica y ofrecerle a su hijo una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María Marleny, 51 years old, has had to work since she was a teenager because of her family's difficult financial situation. She learned to make a living for herself by working in different shops in the area, where she learned a lot about the retail industry. Later, she got married and dedicated her time to the work around her house. When her son was born, she decided she needed to open up her own business in order to help her husband pay their family's household expenses. 

María Marlenny is requesting this loan in order to buy basic goods to stock her store, as well as display glass and shelving. She is looking to improve her store and widen its variety of merchandise. Her biggest wish is to increase the store's profits so that she can help her family financially and offer her son a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy staple goods for her general store.

loans.name: Norfreider

texts.es: Norfreider de 48 años, es casado y tiene 3 hijos menores de edad. Desde hace muchos años se dedicó al comercio, pero debido a malos negocios entró en quiebra, de la cual no se ha logrado recuperar. Inducido por la necesidad decidió montar una fonda en la que vende licor y mecatos, con el último capital con el que contaba. Labora de jueves a domingo y el resto de la semana ofrece servicios de mantenimiento eléctrico en general; Oficio que aprendió desde su juventud. Se encuentra solicitando un crédito para comprar surtido-licor-dulcería, para aumentar sus ventas y generar mayores ingresos para el sostenimiento del hogar. Espera poderse recuperar de la crisis económica por la que se encuentra pasando en estos momentos, para poder ofrecerle a su familia la calidad de vida que tenían antes.
texts.en:
Norfreider, 48, is married and has three minor children.  For many years he made a living in trade, but owing to bad business he entered into bankruptcy, and he hasn't been able to recover.

Prompted by necessity, and with the last capital he had, he decided to set up an establishment where he sells lunches and liquor.  He works from Thursday through Sunday, and the rest of the week he offers general electrical maintenance services, a trade he learned when he was young.
